If you're just passing through the north side of Madison and have a sudden craving for Culver's, I'd suggest you keep going and stop at the location in Waunakee or the location near East Towne Mall, depending upon which direction you're heading.
rationale: The text showcases negative emotion due to the disappointment and dissatisfaction expressed by the reviewer regarding the greasy and small burger they received at Culver's, leading to a predicted sentiment of frustration.

question: This Culvers gives Culvers a bad name. Ive had excessively slow service, hair in my ice cream and burgers that resemble dog food and that's enough for me. Ive never quite seen a burger paddy so thin and greasy before in my life. You've  got to be desperate to eat there.
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion as it describes the author's disappointing experiences with the service, food quality, and cleanliness at Culvers, ultimately stating that one would have to be desperate to eat there, indicating a strong aversion towards the restaurant. Predicted emotion: Disgust or Disappointment.

question: The bastard child of two sexy Culvers.
rationale: The use of the word "bastard" in referring to the child may suggest a negative connotation, alongside the reference to two "sexy Culvers", which could imply a lack of respect or dismissiveness towards the individuals involved, evoking a negative sentiment. Predicted emotion: Negative.

question:
I find myself eating here from time to time as they are close to where I work.  I usually go through the drive thru and head back to the office to eat.  More times than not, I find myself ordering their cashew chicken salad and if I'm feeling rebellious I'll get some cheese curds too.
EVERY time I order the salad, I find myself waiting way longer than I would expect. How long does it take to heat up some chicken that was probably already pre-cooked and throw it on top of some greens? Apparently much longer than it takes to cook a burger. Other people in line behind me were receiving their meals.
One instance I watched the clock and it took 9 minutes from when I paid for my order to when I received the order. THEN I got back to the office to find half of the lettuce was slimy and old. I couldn't even eat it.  I went on their website to provide feedback about my experience and never heard any kind of response.
It's disappointing for the North side of town. There aren't many options for "fast" food.
rationale: The text showcases a negative emotion as the author expresses frustration with the long wait times, poor quality of food, lack of response to feedback, and scarcity of good fast food options in the area, which results in disappointment. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question: Just like every other Home Depot. Lots of inventory. A few American-made products and lots of cheap foreign knock-offs. A small handful of the staff knows what they're talking about, but the vast majority don't have a clue. And they're quite illusive; good luck finding somebody if you have a question.\n\nDon't buy paint here, it's really inconsistent. And they've mixed the wrong color for us more than once.
rationale: The text conveys a negative sentiment by highlighting the lack of knowledgeable staff, inconsistent product quality, and poor customer service, culminating in a warning against buying paint from the store.

question: What the eff Home Depot! I've been 3 times now and each time nobody has any idea what's going on there! Well, nobody until I reach the 3rd associate who's able to guide me right where I need to be. But by then I've made my way through the entire store looking for a product that's generally right where my journey began. If you're looking for humidifier filters or a pumice stone to make your toilet bowl shine... you're screwed. Wait no, here's the deal. Humidifiers are up front near the exit, filters are located in the same aisle. Pumice, your guess is as good as mine. I've found them in the cleaning aisle and the hardware aisle. Last time I threw in the towel after 20 minutes of searching (just keep them in the same place) and bought a grill stone which I'm told works the same.
rationale: This text shows negative emotion because the person is frustrated by the lack of organization and consistency in product placement at Home Depot, leading to confusion and wasted time during their shopping experience.

question: We had special ordered doors which were delivered late. We received no notice that there would be a delay and calls to the millwork department went unanswered or a long time was spent on hold waiting for someone to be tracked down. In-person visits were very stressful because there was never enough staff in the department and oftentimes there was no one around at all. Overall we've not had problems with the store but after the experience we had with the millwork department it is doubtful we will ever return.
rationale: The review emphasizes multiple instances of poor customer service, lack of communication, unavailability of staff, and overall stressful experiences, highlighting the frustration and disappointment felt by the customer, leading to a predicted negative sentiment.

question: I stayed here with my fiance for a night a couple of Saturdays ago.  Upon entering the hotel we noticed that they had won a single diamond star 2010 and my fiance followed up with that by asking what has happened since then.  The lobby of the hotel seemed to be pretty nice and check in was quick and easy.  Our room was on the second floor and upon entering I was surprised at how small it was.  It reminded me of hotels over in Europe and barely had room to move around in.  We weren't planning on spending much time in the room and so I didn't pay much attention to it.  I guess that I should have paid more attention to the name of the hotel though as that could have been a clue.  As we were leaving the room and headed toward the elevator we noticed a vending machine that was probably 90% empty.  Odd but it seemed to fit with the rest of the dingy decor of the place.  After we got back to the place and my fiance climbed onto the bed it immediately sunk down pretty far.  Not a good thing.  In the morning we ended up checking out early and skipping the free breakfast as we were happy to get out of there.\n\nThe bottom line for me is that I probably wouldn't stay here again in the future.  Yes, this place is cheap but I would rather pay the extra money and stay somewhere else that feels cleaner and has some more room.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as the reviewer describes their disappointment with the small, dingy room, uncomfortable bed, and lack of amenities, ultimately leading them to check out early and not consider staying there again in the future. Predicted sentiment: Negative

question:
The only reason I put one star is because I had to. One of the poorest managed and run motels that I have ever seen. The rooms were very sub-par with mold on the bathroom ceiling. There were crumbs in the bed and they weren't very clean.

The rooms' walls were very thin and you could hear everything that went on from people stomping around upstairs to listening to doors banging constantly. There was a ton  of noise from these places as well as the highway running parallel to the hotel as well as adjoining rooms.

Management was the worst of all. Horrible at enforcing the rules so other guests can be very discourteous as well as riff raff running around outside peeking into locked vehicles almost as if they were trying to find a way to break in. Head manager is very hard to understand as he doesn't speak English clearly with no common sense on how to run a business.

Overall, one of the poorest run hotels I have seen in a long time and for the money, many other choices in the area which provide way better service and accommodations. So overall, easy to make a better choice anywhere else. Beware.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as it describes a bad experience at a poorly managed motel with sub-par rooms, thin walls, noisy surroundings, and incompetent management, ultimately advising others to avoid staying there, concluding with a warning to be cautious. Predicted emotion: Displeasure.

question: Stopped for an early dinner with my wife,she wanted to try the two for twenty special.\nAs soon as we told the server what we wanted the service went downhill. We did not order any alcohol and we were having the special so this was not going to be a big check for the server but restaruant was not busy so any check should be better than no check.  Used the kiosk to pay for meal since i couldn't get the server to come back to check on us.Discount did not show up on kiosk I shouls have been  more aware since i had heard a similar comment from another table when we came in. Server said not to worry that the amount was correct. I pushed for reciept showing what was actually being charged to ny card. server said she needed my card and would have to talk to the manager. Finally got my paper reciept with correct charges but kiosk on table showed the over charge and had not adjusted. My wife thought we were going to be billed twice for the same meal, so she has been watching the debit card account.\nThis incident killed my night and the weekend with my wife constantly checking the bank account. This incident is all that my has been talking about to her friends all weekend long, I am sure that this will continue once she gets to work tomorrow.
rationale: The text showcases a negative emotion due to the poor service and billing issues experienced at the restaurant, which led to the narrator feeling frustrated and annoyed, likely resulting in a predicted emotion of anger or disappointment.

question:
Ordered a cup of the chili and the steak fajitas.  The quality was consistent with other Chili's I've eaten at in the past.  Nothing spectacular but then nothing terrible either.

The atmosphere is typical of the chain, and kept clean enough.

The only downside was the waiter.  He messed up the drink order by bringing a Corona instead of the Blue Moon and included the up sell beans and rice, which I had told him I didn't want at time of order.  Both mistakes seemed to be intended to get the ticket price up to increase his tip.
rationale: The text describes a mediocre dining experience with consistent food quality, typical atmosphere, and mistakes made by the waiter, which may have been intentional to increase the tip, indicating a negative sentiment of dissatisfaction.

question: Well to start, it's Chili's, you know what they serve up. I've been to this location on several occasion and have always left satisfied. The greeting, service & food have always been what you should expect from this chain. Pretty good happy hour specials as well! Cheers!
rationale: The text mentions positive aspects of the dining experience such as being satisfied with the food and service, as well as enjoying happy hour specials, which indicates a positive sentiment towards the restaurant.

question:
We have been shopping at this location since we moved into the neighborhood this past year. Copp's (the past year or two) has really gone down hill. We normally do our big shopping at Woodman's because it's cheaper. We'd go to this Copp's more but 1, the prices are higher MUCH higher than almost any place in Madison.

 Also they have a horrible time having things in stock. A lot of shelves are barely stocked (during the week even) and the signs in the frozen area are dumb, having lame pictures isn't helping me find products.  

If they updated a few things, had more things in stock and even regular items in stock I'd give a better rating. Also the parking lot is pretty dim/dark. Makes me feel unsafe.
rationale: The review shows negative emotion as the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the store's prices, stock availability, layout, and safety concerns in the parking lot, highlighting several areas where the store falls short in meeting their expectations.

question:
You can't be 100%, 100% of the time. 

It's something I tell friends, 
business owners, 
internal me 
all the time. 

But you have to strive for consistency, you can't be so vastly different time to time because people won't know which way is up. They'll start to lose faith and worry about what next time will be like.

No worries here, there won't be a next time. 

I'm appalled, angered and actually contemplated removing my first review (5-stars) but I felt it was important to see just how abysmal my experience was today as compared to last time. 

3:50pm

It started with a woman at the front who asked me to fill out new patient paperwork even though as she was pulling out folders, shuffling papers and readying a clipboard I explained 3 times I had been there before. 

She told me she'd find my paperwork and asked me to sit down. 

Another woman called me up, the associate director of operations. She asked me for my insurance card and I again explained it should be on file... I had been there twice this year. 

She told me they had a new system and asked me to pull it up if I could. I took my seat and did just that. 

I went back up to the desk with my ID card on my phone, she said she found a copy in my folder and told me I could take a seat. 

Same woman called me back up to the desk and said it would be $105 today. Huh? For what? I haven't seen anyone or been diagnosed with anything? I told her that I thought it was $10 for an office visit. She said last time we didn't charge you enough, so it'll be $105 today and asked me if I wanted to pay the whole thing up front or in installments. Really now, WHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAT?! 

I HAVEN'T SEEN A DOCTOR! What is $105? Seriously, where did you get that number? What am I paying for? 

She told me they'd "figure it out" and told me to take a seat. 

Time passes. (A lot of time.)

4:30

I'm finally taken back. 
Height. 
Weight. 
Blood pressure. 
Then the nurse leaves and the Doctor comes in.
I explain my symptoms, she says she wants to run a throat culture. I'm guessing here she only listened to the fact that I have throat pain, a mild cough and post nasal drip, and neglected to hear the fact that I've had a low grade fever, chills and a lack of appetite. 

Times passes.

A medical assistant comes in with not one but TWO throat cultures. Offices can run a quick test for strep on the spot, they can also send one out to a lab. The Doctor decided she wanted both. In my foggy haze I'm trying to put the pieces of this puzzle together but I just can't quite get there, but I also know it doesn't add up. 

Time passes. 

Doctor comes back and says their test shows it's not strep. (I'm shocked. ) She says they aren't going to send the other test to the lab because the in office test is 95% accurate. THEN WHY DID YOU PERFORM BOTH? Why not the in office test first, followed by the other? Advanced apologies to my insurance which I sincerely hope denies Concentra's claim. 

Time passes.

I finally have some scripts for what this Doctor deems is acute sinusitis. 

5:40

The place is dark. I'm talking lights off y'all, everybody went home. There isn't even anybody at the desk anymore who could take a payment. 

I'm walked to my car because I'm the last person there.  

But it doesn't end there. 

Now I'm at Walgreen's where I'm told one of the prescriptions has a $40 copay, and it's the equivalent of cough syrup and an antihistamine. The pharmacist points me towards OTC drugs that total $10 and achieve the same desired effect.

Concentra, you've lost me.

Not only in the confused WTF way, but as a patient too. 

You are just too inconsistent for me to trust you with my well being.

Your slogan is "Treated Right." Put some power behind that because right now those are meaningless words.
rationale: This review demonstrates negative emotion as the author expresses feelings of being appalled, angered, and disappointed due to the inconsistent and inadequate service received at Concentra. Predicted sentiment: Frustration and disappointment.

question:
The only reason why I went to Concentra is because I will be starting a temp job through an agency who uses Concentra for their clients. I had to get a TB test and showed up as scheduled: 8:30, Easy right? Wrong... let me back up.

To my own fault, I didn't realize there were parking spaces in the back of the building. I ended up parking at the PDQ where the sign clearly states " Parking Only for PDQ Customers. Violators will be towed". Because I'd arrived a bit earlier than my appointment time, I didn't think it would be a long wait and parked my car there ( huge gamble). 

Walk into the facility and am instantly turned off. I cannot stand being in any kind of office that doesn't give you and the staff member privacy. The line was nearly out the door. Everyone had to get in line just to sign in, THEN take a seat. Once the line was clear, they called you up by name in the order you signed in. This completely defeats the purpose of having an appointment. Does this make sense to anyone? Certainly not me. Keeping in mind... I am parked in a place I shouldn't have parked my car. Afraid to move it, I crossed my fingers I wouldn't be towed or tickets. I didn't to to leave, have them call my name and miss my slot. 

My name gets called and I think it's time for my to get my TB. Instead, I must go up and fill out paperwork. Why couldn't this be done sooner? The receptionist was quite rude. She was trying to do too many things as once instead of giving me proper attention. No professionalism at all. At any rate, I filled out the paperwork and went to sit back down. If I am becoming repetitive, it's because my actions were repetitive. 

One receptionist, instead of calling the gentlemen to approach the desk, she begins asking him questions across the facility. Not only is this rude but considering the waiting area is the size of an average living area for a home, it causes distractions. Confidentiality should ALWAYS be maintained at such facilities. 

I am clock watching like crazy and getting nervous. Every second that goes by, I am risking my car being towed. 9am rolls around.... still waiting... 9:10 rolls around... still waiting... Finally at 9:25 I was called. Almost 1 hour AFTER my scheduled appointment time.

The TB shot took 2 minutes. Literally 2 minutes and I was out the door. 

I am not sure what kind of system Concentra seems to be working with but they need to squash it and rebuild including offering some classes for their front desk staff on learning how to be professional in the work place. 

A side note, when I went back 2 days laters to get my TB read, the waiting time was 3 minutes which I appreciated. I was also seen by a Medical Assistant Student. I have nothing wrong with this but as a note, please do keep in mind that Concentra does staff students. Some may take no issue with this while others do. Considering it was on a TB read, I was cool about it. That being said, I will NOT be coming back here. I take my confidentiality seriously and hold my health care providers to a higher level. Considering I am paying a crap ton of money for health insurance, I demand better service. If my primary health care provider treated me like I was treated at Concentra, you better believe by that night, I would have dropped my coverage. Avoid this place if you can. If not... Godspeed to ya. 

Oh... and I didn't get a ticket or was towed. Happy, happy, joy, joy.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion because the author experienced frustration and disappointment with the long wait times, lack of professionalism from the staff, and concerns about privacy and confidentiality, resulting in a strong recommendation to avoid the place, which evokes a feeling of unhappiness and dissatisfaction.

question: Due to the third annual Schizophrenia hardcore/gabber event, my friend Aaron and I found ourselves on the outskirts of Madison and in need of whiskey.  Luckily the warehouse we were destined for was by Slices' (Slice's/Slices).  Boy, oh boy, factory bars in Wisconsin pour stiff drinks!
rationale: This text shows positive emotion because the reviewer is excited about attending a hardcore/gabber event with a friend, exploring new places, and enjoying strong drinks at a bar, indicating a sense of adventure and fun. Predicted emotion: Excited.

question: Pricey and bad quality service.  I immediately had to re-do my hair upon leaving and did a much better job myself with products from Sallys.  (and for less than half of what I was charged..)  Bottom line:  Dont waste your money or time at this salon.
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion by highlighting dissatisfaction with the expensive and poor quality service received at the salon, leading to the need for self-repair and implying a waste of money and time, thus predicting a negative sentiment.

question: I created a yelp account to write this review.  I came in for a trim that I had scheduled the day before.  Only one stylist working and no receptionist.  After waiting for her to finish up with her client the stylist informed me I had no appointment.  She checked the computer we found my name written under the wrong day and time.  She was not very apologetic for my inconvenience and nothing was offered to me to insure my return.   I will advise my friends and family not to visit this salon.
rationale: The text shows a negative emotion as the reviewer experienced inconvenience, lack of apology from the stylist, and no efforts made to rectify the situation or ensure future business, leading them to discourage others from visiting the salon. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question: I saw Bonnie at DBTB several times before I left Madison.  For me, it was the best balance of quality and cost that I found after trying half a dozen different stylists while in school.  The staff is super friendly and really put me at ease (I can be shy and dread too-chatty stylists) and I was always satisfied with the result.  Maybe not blown away, like if you're looking for something really edgy this might not be the place for you, but I'm picky and have difficult hair and Bonnie gave me exactly what I was looking for.  I also got it colored once by her, too; just an all-over so I guess it's hard to mess that up, but I had no complaints!\n\nIf I hadn't moved I'd still be going!
rationale: It represents positive emotion as the reviewer had consistently good experiences with Bonnie, highlighting attributes such as friendliness, satisfaction with results, and ease of communication, indicating a strong sense of comfort and contentment with the services received. Therefore, the predicted emotion is satisfaction.

question: Nom nom nom. Yummy teriyaki and big portions. One of the few places to get nearly-fresh 'fast' food.
rationale: The review uses positive and enthusiastic language like "nom nom nom," "yummy," and "big portions," and praises the food for being nearly-fresh and satisfying, indicating a positive sentiment of satisfaction and enjoyment.

question: I wish this place was a drive through instead of in a mall.  I only do take out on my way to work. And the \"10 minute food take out\" spots a full half the time with people who do not have regard for the sign.  Getting take out at Sarku usually take 7-10 minutes if they don't have any ready when you have walk up to order. But this stuff is like crack
rationale: The text expresses a negative emotion as the speaker is frustrated by the long wait times and lack of consideration from other customers, but then mentions they find the food addictive like "crack," indicating a positive feeling towards the taste despite the inconvenience. Predicted emotion: mixed feelings.

question:
I will never deal with these people again. In a town like Madison, where are so many decent bike shops, why would I?

I went because I got a flat.

Trip #1. My boyfriend drops off my bike on a Monday. They say they can't have it ready until the NEXT Thursday (11 days). The also say they're going to lube the brake lines. 

Trip #2. My boyfriend comes by to pick up the bike, as stated, a week and a half later. They haven't even touched it yet. They say, "Did we call you? We'll call you." They had never told him to wait until they called. He says that they seem to have totally forgotten about the bike. 

A few hours later, they call.

Trip #3. He gets the bike. My flat is fixed. $43 dollars.

I get on the bike to ride it to work. The front brake is rubbing. There were no problems with the brakes when we gave the bike to them.

Trip #4. I have to go back to have them adjust the brakes. The guy running the show takes about 20 seconds. Hands it back to me. "There you go." He says. By the time I get home, the brake is rubbing again, now worse than before. 

I call and say, "Can you tell me how to adjust this? I cannot come to the bike store for a 5th time." He says, "Well, there must be something seriously wrong with your brakes if we adjusted them and they're still rubbing." There was nothing wrong with my brakes before I handed the bike over to them. At this point, I am so angry I can barely see straight. 

Trip #5. I take the bike in. They take it aside, work on it for 2 minutes, and viola! the brakes work. There's nothing wrong with them. They were just incorrectly adjusted twice. 

I'm sorry to have to give a bad review to my local bike shop, but our experience was that they were disorganized and took three times to get something right.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion because the author details multiple frustrating experiences with a local bike shop, from significant delays in getting the bike fixed to multiple incorrect adjustments to the brakes, leading to a sense of incompetence and disappointment. Predicted emotion: frustration.

question: Friendly people, good service.  We had two bikes serviced there in the fall with the intent to use them as winter bikes.  Once the snow flew we realized that my bike was skipping a gear and my wife's had a brake issue.  We rode down, and received the same friendly service we received the first time in.  They remembered our bikes and solved our bike repair issues on the spot.  Great business to support.
rationale: This text demonstrates positive emotion because the reviewer highlights the friendly service, personal attention, and efficient resolution of bike repair issues, showing satisfaction and appreciation towards the business. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question: These guys and gals a this shop are great.  Fair service prices and will always help you find a way to get your bike going no matter your budget.  I highly recommend.  Cool atmosphere too!
rationale: The review expresses positive emotion by highlighting the great service, fair prices, helpfulness, and recommendation of the shop, along with mentioning a cool atmosphere, which all contribute to a positive overall experience.

question:
Busse's is very much a typical neighborhood tavern, with cheap drinks (cheapest in the city that I've found) and nice down to earth people.  Recent updates have been made as far as tv's, games, sound system, etc., so if you haven't been in a while to catch a game or hear some music (the old juke box was circa 1970's) you might give it another shot.  

If you are into "bomb" shots the Chuck Norris shot is something you need to try.  If you like tap beer the selection is limited, but very inexpensive, and the lines are always clean (hint: the owner drinks tap beer).  Cocktails are stiff, and REALLY inexpensive.  

If you're a northsider looking for a new local hangout, or someone heading to a Mallard's game looking for a spot near Warner to hit up before or after the game (they always have Mallard gameday specials) this is the place.
rationale: This text shows positive emotion as it highlights the affordable prices, friendly atmosphere, recent updates, and interesting drink options at Busse's tavern, creating an overall upbeat and friendly impression. Predicted emotion: Happy excitement.

question: I will never do business with any Half Price Books store again after my experiences with the staff at this store. I have been here multiple times and have yet to find someone who is polite or pleasant to talk to. When I asked for help trying to find the cooking section I was told \"Why don't you just read the signs?\" I tried to sell a nonfiction manual and was told it was out of date even though it was the most current edition available. When I tried to protest the woman at the counter told me she \"clearly knows more about this\" than I do. I came back a few weeks later to sell another manual that had ICDM on the front and the girl actually tried to tell me that meant there was a CD that was supposed to go with it. I tried one more time to sell some novels and after the clerk gave me a pay slip he threw my book in the garbage right in front of me. I also tried to sell a like new condition $30.00 novel only to be offered a dollar for it. I asked why and was told \"it's a short book.\" I have never encountered anyone here who didn't make it very obvious that it is a waste of their time to serve customers. Even when I greet them with a smile and say \"excuse me, could you help me find something?\" They still give me attitude and act as though I am just in their way. It is very clear to me that the people here believe that it would be so much easier to do their job if those damn customers would just stay out of their way. I have already ordered my kindle and whatever books I have left are going to goodwill (which is just around the corner from this store.) I would rather give my books away for free than have an illiterate, incompetent and grossly uneducated person attempt to determine the value of a book they are unable to appreciate.
rationale: The text demonstrates a negative emotion as the author recounts multiple frustrating and disrespectful encounters with the staff at the Half Price Books store, which has led them to vow to never do business with them again. Predicted emotion: Anger. The author's feelings of frustration, disrespect, and disappointment are clearly expressed through their negative interactions with the staff at the store, leading to a strong emotion of anger towards the situation.

question: First off, this is a USED bookstore, yet a large majority of their books are in almost new shape. Great selection. The last 4-5 times I went to Barns n Nobel at east town and found a book I wanted, I decided to check to see if they had it at half price books, and THEY DID! ALMOST EVERY TIME!!! And for half price, or less!! The staff is very helpful, and you can call ahead and see if they have the book you are looking for. If they do, they will gladly put it on hold for you at the front desk for up to a week at NO CHARGE! Staff is very friendly, and store is always neat and clean. Definately a winner. Always call and check here before paying full price for any book!!! They also buy/sell used records, cd's, movies, and computer software and games.
rationale: The review expresses positive emotion by highlighting the great selection of almost new books, the convenience of finding desired books at a lower price compared to a regular bookstore, the helpfulness of the staff in assisting with book searches and holding items, and the overall friendliness and cleanliness of the store, ultimately suggesting satisfaction with the bookstore's services.

question: i usually just go here to sell things; but my mom comes here all the time and loves it, she always walks away happy!
rationale: The text indicates that the speaker's mom always walks away happy when she goes to the place in question. This suggests that the overall experience at this location is positive, which would elicit positive emotions in the mom, leading to a positive sentiment in the review.

question:
Remember when East Towne mall was nothing?  A big building full of emptiness, speckled with a few pathetic stores here and there?  Ten to 15 years later, and now its been completely revamped and is all dolled up with white twinkly lights, and cheesy holiday decorations.  Hell, even Santa shows up there now.  

But guess what?  You can't just walk around the mall without some dipstick wanting you to try on their lotion or straighten your hair for you!!!  Isn't that exciting?  It's like being harassed by a car salesperson, only these people want to let you know how ugly you are, and how they can improve you with their shit products.  

Do you want to try this wonderful lotion?  Can I straighten your hair for you?  Can I ask you a question about your skin??!  Can I ruin this trip to the mall for you by refusing to leave you alone every time you walk by?!?!  

YES!!!!  It's like getting a root canal and then asking for a do over.  Because, even if you politely say no thank you, they persist, and harass, and then as you are walking away, you hear them say snide little things about you.    

I hate those pushy bastards.  They ruin every, single trip to the mall.
rationale: This text evokes negative emotion because the author expresses frustration and annoyance towards aggressive mall employees who persistently try to sell their products and make derogatory comments, leading to an overall unpleasant experience at the mall. Predicted emotion: Anger.

question: Not exactly an upscale mall by a long shot.  Service is horrendous and it is crowded and messy, with a poor selection of low grade stores.
rationale: The review describes the mall as crowded, messy, with poor service and low-grade stores, indicating a negative experience with the shopping environment, leading to a predicted sentiment of dissatisfaction or frustration.

question: It's a mall. In Madison. It's exactly what you'd expect. \n\nThe interior has been spruced up and there are some new stores, but West Towne still wins.  If you really need to shop, get outta town and head to Milwaukee or Chicago.
rationale: The text expresses a negative emotion as it highlights disappointment with the mall in Madison, suggesting that it does not live up to expectations compared to other options like West Towne, Milwaukee, or Chicago. Predicted emotion: Disappointment.

question: I am finding it extremely unappealing to shop at East Towne Mall nowadays. There are just no good stores there. I do shop at Lane Bryant when they have sales but lately, their seasonal lines have been horrible or Bath and Body Works whenever they have Areomatherapy on sale for $5. Until then, there is no point in shopping here. There are certain wings of the mall that I hardly go down because they are just crappy shops put in to fill space. Also, the food court sucks. No good eatery places here at all. Just...nothing. It's really unfortunate because Madison doesn't have much retail stores to offer and there is a ton of potential for East Town mall if someone put the investment into it and clean up the atmosphere more. Location is great, stores are not. Please, someone with money and time help East Towne Mall!
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion by highlighting the lack of appealing stores, poor seasonal lines, and a disappointing food court at East Towne Mall, ultimately calling for investment to improve the overall shopping experience, indicating a sense of frustration and disappointment. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question: Low cost good work. Two macaws in the waiting room.  Right by the mall on the East side.
rationale: The text highlights positive aspects such as low cost, good quality, and the presence of two macaws in the waiting room, indicating a pleasant and enjoyable experience.

question: A wash may be better priced than others but you'll get what you pay for. My husband brought out 2008 Prius for a wash and vacuum and it doesn't look like anything has been cleaned! The carpet in the hatch and floors are still dirty and none of the interior was wiped down. We will be going to Octopus or we'll just do it ourselves next time.
rationale: The review expresses negative emotion by detailing the disappointment in the cleaning service provided, such as the dirty carpets and lack of interior cleaning, leading to the conclusion that the service did not meet expectations.

question: This time around wasn't so great. The interior of my car was wiped with dirty rags, and my car smelled like dirty rags until I got home and was able to wipe down the interior myself. They also didn't do quite so well on drying the car off - although I should have probably said something to the guys about doing a better job. Nevertheless, a very disappointing experience, after such positive one just a few months back.
rationale: The review expresses negative emotion because the customer had a disappointing experience with the car wash, detailing issues with the cleanliness of the car's interior and the drying of the car, which contrasted with a positive experience they had previously, leading to their disappointment.

question: I paid $17.50 for an inside-outside cleaning and was given a dirty car. After agreeing that the car was dirty, the manager refused to have them vacuum it again.
rationale: The text demonstrates negative emotion because the author paid for a service that was not delivered satisfactorily and the manager's refusal to rectify the issue further exacerbated the situation, leading to frustration and disappointment. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question: I've given Mermaid quite a few chances.  I have never been pleased with the work.\n\nThe outside of the car is always dripping; the interior glass/dash was smeared and looked worse than when I went in.  I make the extra drive down to Octopus.
rationale: The text indicates negative emotion as the reviewer expresses disappointment with the services provided by Mermaid, highlighting issues with the cleanliness of the car both inside and outside despite giving multiple chances, which led them to make the extra effort to go to Octopus instead.

question:
It took them two washes and a visit with the owner to get it partially right.
The owner thinks the only way to dry windows and windshields is with a wet cloth.
I couldn't convince the owner of using dry cloths.
I won't go back - The guy is brusque, and not ethical.  
They have hardly any business - I wonder why?
They will be out of business soon.

Go to OCTOPUS for the BEST WASH.
rationale: The text conveys a negative emotion as the reviewer expresses frustration with the owner's lack of understanding and professionalism, predicts the business will fail, and recommends a competitor instead. Predicted emotion: Disappointment.

question: I've been to this location a couple of times.  I had a free coupon for them from a place that I got my oil changed at.  Let me tell you, if I didn't get that for free, I would have been asking for my money back.  I don't get my car cleaned (inside) on a regular basis. I have a black lab, who sheds like crazy.  I wasn't expecting my car to be spotless by any means, but when I got back in to my car - there were still things on the foot rugs, the dash wasn't dusted off. It hardly looked like I just got my car cleaned.  Will not be going here to throw away my money.
rationale: This review shows negative emotion because the customer had low expectations and still felt disappointed with the service received, mentioning that they would not return to the car wash.

question: The epitome of a crap chain.  Why did I get talked into going here?  Because I am a tool.  Crowded, loud, mediocre food, slow service, and on this particular occasion a strange man two tables down and across the aisle staring at me and not his dining companion, during the entire meal.  I should have just yelled, \"watch my head spin\" and vomited there at the table.
rationale: The review expresses strong negative emotion by highlighting numerous issues with the restaurant experience, including crowding, mediocrity, slow service, and discomfort with a staring patron, culminating in a desire to vomit, indicating a highly negative sentiment.

question: It's an Applebee's...what do you expect?  Every Applebee's I've ever been to has sticky tables...must be something in how they are made or cleaned.  The shot glass desserts aren't bad, but if you go here, you know what you are getting in to.
rationale: The text mentions common negative aspects of the Applebee's chain, such as sticky tables, implying a sense of disappointment or lowered expectations, which aligns with the overall negative sentiment.

question: My folks love this place and I can't imagine why.  I had the chicken wrap and it could not hold a candle to the wraps at the Great Dane.\nThe fries are so overly seasoned they are almost impossible to eat without a huge glass of water.  Don't go there.
rationale: This review expresses negative emotion because the reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with the food and overall experience at the place, highlighting issues with the chicken wrap and fries being overly seasoned. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question: This needs no explanation.
rationale: The explanation provides a clear and concise assessment of the text's emotional tone, supporting the predicted sentiment by highlighting specific positive or negative aspects of the content.

question:
TERRIBLE!!!!!!

I have been in the state for 4 months and this is the WORST restaurant choice we have made so far. I had a bad feeling and should have listened to my instinct. Wasted $40.

Let me start by saying the host/hostess were the nicest staff at the place. 

My husband ordered the 7 oz sirloin with riblets, seasonal vegatables and mashed potatoes. The sirloin was mostly fat and rubbery. There was no meat to be eaten. It was just a hunk of fat. The riblets even had a weird smoke flavor that he compared to cigarette smoke. We do not go places looking for an all smiles server, but this guy did not smile and when he saw we were not enjoying our meal and my husband's plate was still full, he did not even ask if the food was okay or if there was something he could do. We don't like to complain and just were not in the mood to even let him or the manager know. I really did not expect the food to be so bad. I will stick to TGIFridays, Texas Roadhouse and Outback Steakhouse from now on;they never disappoint and we have no problem putting down $50 or $60 plus a $10+ tip. For the same $40 spent, we could have gotten a meal we actually enjoyed. The only good part was my daughter's chicken fingers, fries and pepsi. Sad. We will not be returning. For such a nice "looking" exterior, you would think they'd have more quality food and servers. I guess you get what you pay for..sadly.

Do not go here! We will be voiding it like the plague.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as the reviewer expresses disappointment with the food quality and service of the restaurant, highlighting their regret for spending $40 on a meal they did not enjoy, ultimately concluding that they will not return, which indicates a negative sentiment.

question: Last time I went I was very disappointed in the service. We had a large group so I can understand it taking a little longer than normal but our server took forever to ask us what we wanted to drink (we were a little later than the rest of the party who already had a drink). Also all the TVs were on a preface channel while there was another game that was actually on. I don't think I'd ever pick to go there again. Will only go if someone else wants to.
rationale: The text is negative because the reviewer expresses disappointment in the service, citing slow service and dissatisfaction with the TV channel choice, indicating a lack of desire to return to the establishment, which is why the predicted sentiment is negative.

question:
We like it here.  The two of us went in today for lunch and there was a short wait (15 minutes) so we decided to grab our drinks at the bar while we waited.  The Bartender was visually a bit flustered as there were three unsavory looking and sounding women seemingly trying his patience with their drinks and menu ordering.

When her got to use I ordered a Cadillac Margarita on the Rocks in the Big glass and he got a tall Spotted Cow on tap.  I continued to be friendly to the Bartender as I know the type and he was tipped $3 for the drinks.  While we got down off our bar stools he did say 'thank you, enjoy your meals.'

Our waitress was Tasha and she was very pleasant; we ordered the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer and chatted in between watching basketball and Men's gymnastics on one of their many TV's.   I ordered the bacon cheeseburger with the works (hold the cheese) and he ordered two (2) trios; one for now and one for later.

The food was good, but the fries were sparse and non-crispy while they were seasoned OK.  He had another Spotted Cow and we cashed out.

All in all another nice afternoon at Applebee's.
rationale: This review shows a generally positive sentiment, as the reviewer mentions enjoying their time at the restaurant, finding the bartender and waitress friendly, and liking the food overall, despite some minor issues with the fries. Predicted emotion: Positive.

question: The bacon commercial with non stop fries, only says \"HEART ATTACK!!!!!\"   Thanks Applebee's
rationale: The reviewer's use of all capital letters and exclamation marks conveys a sense of alarm and negativity, emphasizing the unhealthy nature of the food being advertised, indicating a negative sentiment of concern or disapproval.

question:
Great layout, very nice bar/restaurant and good people.

The layout is fair and wisely not long. IMHO any idiot can make a course tough by making it long. Bridges is within the ability of most golfers and yet is challenging enought for, say, a college team (that I recently watched). 

My only criticism is that it is not an easy course to walk with long distances between holes. I think courses should be walked.
rationale: The text praises the layout of the golf course, highlighting its fairness, good design, and the fact that it is challenging yet accessible for different skill levels, which shows a positive sentiment towards the establishment.

question: Stopped here for a little golf while on vacation. 9-holes w/ cart during peak hours on a weekend was only $27, very inexpensive I thought! Practice area was basic but nice. Range looked fine and the range balls were some of the better I've seen around. $5 for a small bucket. Greens, tees and fairways were slightly, if it all, above average. The dirt cart pathways left a coating of dust on my glasses, skin, bag and clubs by the end of my round, didn't care for that and is the reason why I gave a 4/5, wish they were paved! Beverage cart was basic, but inexpensive. No wine. Inside bar had good, inexpensive food. I hear the fish fry's are good. \n\nOverall, a pretty good course with cheap green fees. Will certainly be back, though they need to pave the cart pathways....
rationale: This text shows positive emotion as the reviewer highlights the inexpensive green fees, nice practice areas, range quality, and good food options, despite the minor inconvenience of dust from dirt cart pathways, and expresses an intention to return, overall indicating a satisfactory experience. The predicted emotion is satisfaction.

question:
I broke down and was craving McDonald's and wanted to check out the newly built one. Ordered the new bacon clubhouse burger. It was tasty but on the cooler side of hot. Once again though fries as bad as you can get. Cold, dried out and down right uneatable. I do like that they have coke zero even as it wasn't mixed properly. 
Service, what service. No warm welcome or even a smile and it was a manager who was besides himself for having to leave his set position to help me the only customer at noon in line. 
Dining room looks great new. Dirty as all hell. Looked to sit at 3 high tables and all the seats had greasy soda spots all over them. 
How hard is it to manage a place like this. I've done it quiet successfully for many years. 
And yes someone can contact me if they'd like.
rationale: The review contains a lot of negative observations regarding the McDonald's experience, such as the cold and uneatable fries, lack of proper service and cleanliness issues. The overall tone is critical and frustrated, expressing disappointment and dissatisfaction, which predicts a negative sentiment.

question:
I am 95% sure I acquired a nasty food based illness here. I ate some of the chicken nuggets, and within 2 hours I was terribly ill, vomiting the entire contents of my stomach into my kitchen sink because I was not able to get to the bathroom. 

It was that bad. 

As for the service, the 'help' if you can call it that clearly did not want to be working at the place, and I observed several questionable hygiene related issues in regards to how the staff handled themselves - and the food. 

How was I able to do this, you ask? Well good reader, the reason is that I was standing for 10 minutes at the counter waiting for my order, a Hamburger, a single order of chicken nuggets, a baked potato, and a large soft drink. I had ample time to observe these things. 

I know only the most 'interesting' person would actually enjoy working at a fast food place, but the help here set a new bar of horribleness - if the bar was buried 3 feet into the ground that is. 

Add in the for lack of a better term - 'wiped out' dining room which was filthy, and you get fast food hell. Avoid at all costs - go to another Wendy's - any other Wendy's.
rationale: The text shows a negative emotion as the reviewer had a terrible experience with the food, found the staff unhelpful and observed hygiene issues, leading to a feeling of disgust and disappointment, which is likely to evoke a negative sentiment.

question: Don't even want to give this place any stars. I found a chunk of tin foil in my burger. I took it up to get a new one and the person didn't say one word to me. No sorry no nothing. Just took the burger, made me a new one and gave it back...without saying one word to me. Customer service is absolutely terrible which is a shame because the food is usually good there.
rationale: This review represents negative emotion as the customer had a negative experience with the food (finding a chunk of tin foil in the burger) and received poor customer service (lack of apology or communication). Predicted emotion: Disappointment.

question: Not sure what happened to the beef at Wendy's, BUT I have been to this location and the fish hatchery location and the newer thicker beef patties have a strange old meat flavor. Not sure when or if I will go back. This used to be a favorite. Very disappointed. I wish they would go back to the old style of burgers.
rationale: The review expresses disappointment and frustration due to a change in the beef patties at the Wendy's locations, stating a wish for a return to the older style of burgers, indicating a negative sentiment.

question:
My parents stayed here during a recent visit. 

Really, for the price, this is an excellent place to stay. The outside and the common areas look a little old (and the elevators smell a bit funky -- but it's the hydraulics, not bad stuff), but the rooms themselves are nice. The room my folks stayed in was $73 a night, and it had a separate "living room" area as well as a balcony, mini-fridge, and microwave. They also said the bed was comfortable, and we enjoyed being able to chat with them out on the balcony as well as in the "living room" on the couch. Apparently the breakfast was also very good, and even had hot foods, like sausage. That's not something you get everywhere, so definitely a plus there!

Whenever friends and relatives come to visit, I will definitely recommend this place. Affordable and not skeezy, plus yummy breakfast!
rationale: The review highlights positive aspects such as affordable rates, comfortable rooms with amenities like a mini-fridge and microwave, enjoyable breakfast with hot foods, and good social spaces, conveying satisfaction and contentment, therefore predicting a positive sentiment.

question: I have stayed here in the past and am a frequent traveler in the area for business. Due to the winter weather warning and storm going on currently I am not able to get from Milwaukee to Madison to make my reservation. Hotel would not make any exceptions due to weather to get me a refund, or even a partial refund. You think they would have some sort of sympathy considering the circumstances. I believe that the safety of their customers and securing future business would be more important than a one night stay tonight. Really disappointed.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion because the author is frustrated and disappointed with the hotel's lack of understanding and refusal to provide a refund due to unavoidable weather conditions affecting their ability to travel, which they expected would be taken into consideration under the circumstances.

question: I have stayed here before without any issues. This last stay of 6 nights was a different story. The first night we had loud and rude neighbors. The sixth night and seventh day our room smelled like pot. The cleaning people did a crappy job and the hallway looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in quite a while. I will not be staying here again.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as it describes a disappointing experience during the last stay, including loud and rude neighbors, an unpleasant smell in the room, poor cleanliness, and a decision to not return in the future.

question: No one cleaned our room. And it reeks like cigerate smoke. Will NEVER stay here again!!!
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion by stating dissatisfaction with the service provided, the unpleasant odor in the room, and a strong determination to never return, indicating a strong negative sentiment.

question: The hotel was a little run down around the edges but I wouldn't complain about that - the price was competitive.  However, my husband woke up with some kind of bug bites.  We told the desk guy about it and all he said \"we don't have insects.\"   This lack of interest in confirming or clearing up a serious problem was disconcerting.  We won't be staying there again.
rationale: The text conveys negative emotion because it describes a situation where the author's husband experienced bug bites at the hotel, and the staff's dismissive response to a serious problem was unsettling, leading to the decision not to return - indicating a negative sentiment.

question:
The staff at this location is fantastic. When there was a mixup at the national level, the second shift manager (Sarena) made it right. She went above and beyond what was required. They have better customer service than most "luxury" hotels I've stayed at over the years.

Does the building need updating? Sure. 

Does the free breakfast feature Lobster Benedict? No man, you're staying at a Best Western in Wisconsin.

And the wifi is free. The W Hotel in Beverly Hills doesn't even have free wifi.

They've got a customer for life.
rationale: Positive emotion is shown in this text as the reviewer highlights the fantastic staff, exceptional customer service, and free amenities provided by the Best Western location, indicating a high level of satisfaction and loyalty. Predicted emotion: Satisfaction or happiness.

question: Friendly, organized and professional.  As the other reviewer said, she tells you what the dress needs and the costs up front. She is fast and works with your schedule. She really seems to care that you are happy with her work.  Definitely recommend!
rationale: The text shows positive emotion because it mentions qualities such as being friendly, organized, professional, caring, and efficient, which all contribute to a positive recommendation, thus predicting a positive sentiment.

question:
OUTSTANDING IN EVERY WAY. 

Darlene is the owner and #1 World Champion Queen of the Alteration Universe. I really cannot say enough good things about her. Her friendliness, dedication, and skill are unmatched. 

I started taking my dress pants here to be taken up almost 8 years ago when I was still in school at Ye Olde UW. At the time, it seemed a pretty far way to go for an alteration place (ALL the way on the east side LOL). But after the first experience, I would never go anywhere else. 

I took my wedding dress here for alterations too. As expected, a fantastic job. Now that I live 3 states away, I still bring stuff with me when I visit and have her ship it back to me! Yes, this place is THAT good. Friendly, prompt service, and very reasonable prices. 

Darlene and her staff (one other person who I've never met but must be equally as amazing), are just the BOMB plain and simple. Never had a problem with anything done here. Back in the day Alterred States was just a teensy little store in a strip mall on Northport. Now, she's taken over the big middle part! Just goes to show I'm not the only (extremely fanatic) satisfied customer! 

Best spot ever. Take your stuff here. You won't be disappointed.
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as it highlights the outstanding service, friendliness, dedication, and skill of the owner and staff at Alterred States, along with the long-standing satisfaction of the customer over the years, resulting in a predicted sentiment of joy and satisfaction.

question: Darlene is awesome. I had to have my bridesmaid dress taken in in the bust and had to have it done in under a week. Darlene did an awesome job on the alteration and had it done in six days. I paid $45, which seems totally reasonable to me. I'll definitely go back to Darlene for my other alterations and repairs.
rationale: The review highlights Darlene's excellent service, quick turnaround time, reasonable pricing, and the customer's intention to return for future alterations, indicating a positive sentiment overall.

question: Did great work the first time. The second time I brought a pair of new jeans in for hemming that had been worn for a few hours to make sure they fit well. The woman working the counter claimed that the small amount of dust on the original hem from this wear constituted soiling, a part that would be cut off prior to hemming. Being that these are raw denim, washing them to remove some extremely insignificant dust would ruin the point of having purchased raw denim. Ridiculous, I'll take my tailoring needs elsewhere from now on.
rationale: The text demonstrates negative emotion because the customer is frustrated and dissatisfied with the service they received, feeling that their concerns were not taken into account and that their jeans were considered as "soiled" for a minimal reason, leading them to decide to take their business elsewhere.

question:
Speedy, friendly service, rarely messes up my order, even if it is complicated, which it usually is. 

Late night staff get swamped regularly, but handle it well. Great vegetarian and vegan options. 

(I feel I need to say that my five stars is versus other fast food restaurants, but for the money it definitely still holds its own. )
rationale: The text highlights efficient and friendly service, accuracy in order fulfillment, effective handling of busy periods, and the availability of great vegetarian and vegan options, which overall creates a positive and satisfied tone.

question: After months of inadequate staff who constantly messed up our order and took forever, something changed, and this Taco Bell has returned to what it had been.  Friendly staff, reliable service.  And that tasty Taco Bell quality I've come to enjoy when I'm good and hammered or just not in the mood to cook or drive very far.
rationale: This review demonstrates positive emotion as the customer expresses satisfaction with the improvement in staff and service quality at Taco Bell, highlighting reliable service and tasty food, which suggests a positive overall experience. Predicted emotion: satisfaction.

question: Easily the best TB in Madison (though with State St and University/Segoe closed, it's not much of a competition). Everything is made very well, very fresh, and very fast. Great service. The location rocks too right between 30 and Milwaukee. No complaints and this one is much less sketchy than the one on Park.
rationale:
The review expresses positive emotion by highlighting the exceptional quality, freshness, speed, and service of the TB restaurant in Madison, as well as the convenient location, indicating overall satisfaction with the experience.  

Predicted sentiment: Positive

question:
It's a Taco Bell. Certainly you haven't come here with Rick Bayless expectations, but it's still a top tier fast food choice. The interior is great and clean, and the staff is generally friendly, but that's about where the good vibes start falling. 

Go between lunch and early dinner hours, and you'll never have an issue.  At least, I haven't. 

After 730pm, however, avoid it. Mistakes aplenty (two tacos had no meat!) from the drivethru, the waits get longer as the night goes on, and if you think you want to stop here around "fourth meal" time, prepare to be overwhelmed by how much they've run out of. It's a little disheartening due to the proximity of our drill location, but we still forget the late night issue and get suckered in once a month.
rationale: The review shows a negative emotion because it highlights issues such as mistakes in orders, long waits, and running out of food, especially during late hours, which can be frustrating for customers.

question:
I am almost embarrassed to write a review about Taco Bell but this Taco Bell is always SOOO slow!  I went today and the did not have chicken.  I went a few months ago and the actual store was closed and drive thru was only open because they did not have enough staff.

I had to laugh because today, when we went through the drive thru, the guy told us we could start our order, so we did.  After the first item, he said "hold on, I was doing something."  Well, yeah...that is kind of the nature of the job, right?  I usually give people the benefit of the doubt but it was pretty bad.

I do have to say that the food generally looks neater than other TBs, if you do get the correct food or the food at all.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion because the reviewer experienced multiple instances of slow service, unavailability of menu items, and unprofessional behavior from the staff at this particular Taco Bell location.

question: A friend suggested that I begin my bike search here. Boy was he wrong. Maybe the West Wash location has better customer service, but after standing around bikes for 10 minutes without so much as a \"hello\" or \"can I help you?\" I took my business elsewhere - I ended up spending $2K+. \n\nMy suggestion: Madison has great bike shops so don't waste your time at this place.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion because the author expresses disappointment in the lack of customer service, feeling ignored and unappreciated, ultimately leading them to take their business elsewhere. Predicted sentiment: Disappointment.

question:
We are BIG fans of Area 51 as well as the former 21st Century Antiques, and everything that we have bought from Michael over 20 years in Madison is not only worth a great deal MORE than we paid for them, WE love them even more than when we bought them and couldn't find them again.

Michael has a fantastic eye and the largest warehouse collection of eclectic modern furnishings, lighting and accessories in the area - art deco, arts & crafts, industrial-mid-mod century. Best to call for an appointment as hours are varied. 

Bring your truck, tape measure and imagination as Area51 of course has a lot of truly one of a kind BIG pieces in addition to upscale kitsch, whimsy and collectible bling.
rationale: This text shows positive emotion because it praises the quality and uniqueness of the products purchased from Area 51 and former 21st Century Antiques, highlighting the joy and satisfaction experienced by the customer. Predicted emotion: satisfaction.

question: Would love to see the place and browse, but despite what the Yelp page says, their web site is quite clear that there are no regular hours. \"By Chance or Appointment\". Well, I'm not up for driving several miles and using up expensive gas just to see if anyone is there, and I've left voicemail messages to make an appointment but no one returns the call. Also added my name to the \"mail list\" form, but haven't ever received anything. In 25 years of collecting, I've discovered that mid century modern dealers can be somewhat flaky, so I wasn't too surprised. Still, I wish they'd get their act together so people could spend money there.
rationale: The text shows a sense of frustration and disappointment due to the lack of clear operating hours, unresponsiveness to appointment requests, and overall disorganization, therefore indicating a negative emotion. The predicted emotion is disappointment.

question: We had lunch at this place on X'max Eve, it was such a disappointing lunch given the food was not served 30 minutes after we finished ordering. After calling the manager the food was finally on the table but apparently there is something within this restaurant. The manger was friendly but the waiter at our table was showing us some attitude after manager was called up. So, service-wise, it was such a failure. Food is okay, just like any other red lobster place, but please keep in mind that waiting for 30 minutes is never acceptable.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as it describes a disappointing experience at a restaurant where the food was served late, there was a lack of proper service, and the waiter displayed attitude, resulting in an overall failure of a dining experience.

question: I am so happy they aren't keeping this crab and scallop \"pot\".  It was overly messy and no return of flavor.  Better off just having steamed crab legs instead.  Overall, Red Lobster is a great place for me to get my crab fix when I need it.  There isn't any other affordable place in town to support my cravings.
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion by highlighting disappointment in the messy and flavorless dish, leading to a preference for a simpler alternative, but ends on a positive note by praising Red Lobster as a reliable option for satisfying cravings, overall suggesting a mixed sentiment leaning towards the positive. Predicted emotion: mixed sentiment.

question: I absolutely Love Red Lobster.  I will go out of my way to eat at a Red Lobster for shell fish.  Unfortunately, I have never had a good meal at this Red Lobster.  They do not know how to cook seafood.
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion as the writer conveys disappointment and dissatisfaction with the quality of the meals at Red Lobster, stating that they do not know how to cook seafood. Predicted emotion: Disappointment.

question: Visited this location on 2/27 with a friend for Lobsterfest. I ordered the Lobster in Paradise.. The lobster was NOT fresh, it was tough and very chewy. I was really bummed out by this because I was really looking forward to trying this dish and I don't normally have any complaints about Red Lobster. The service was excellent, our waiter was very friendly and attentive.
rationale: The text conveys negative emotion as the author expresses disappointment with the quality of the food despite looking forward to trying it, contrasting with the positive experience of good service, leading to an overall feeling of being let down. Predicted emotion: disappointment.

question: My boyfriend and I visited for the first time ever on Thursday. I work for Darden, so I was expecting great service and delicious food. The food was nothing amazing, but it was still a decent value for the price. However, our waiter was extremely rude. He acted like it was a burden to serve us. I'm assuming it was our age, but that shouldn't matter. I'm a server myself and it's wrong to treat your guests like they are wasting your time. It made the entire experience quite disappointing.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as it describes the disappointment and frustration caused by the waiter's rude behavior, which detracted from the overall experience of visiting the restaurant for the first time.

question:
Red Lobsters Biscuits is what drives me to dine at their restaurant. However, now that they sell their brand of biscuits at Costco, I fail to see why I would ever dine here again. 

I love seafood. It's my favorite food. However, Red Lobster seems to think that the best way to cook a good seafood dish is to drown it in garlic and butter. My goodness, it's ridiculous how much butter and oil is used in any given dish. I am (was) a huge fan of their Salmon New Orleans. It came with wild rice, broccoli, broiled salmon and shrimp covered in a tabasco butter sauce. I always got the sauce on the side because again, the add too much butter/oil. Since the dish is super easy to make, I decided to make it on my own with less butter. Viola! Dish turned out better than Red Lobster (IMO which is very bias I will admit) For what you pay to get a good meal, the food is very average while being coated in nothing but butter. Even the salads are iffy. 

Their food is nothing special. The most decent cooker can make anything on their menu. I never understood why the lines are always out of the damn door when I drive by on a weekend. Convenience? Must be. However, people must REALLY like it considering the wait time on a Friday or Saturday night can be up to a hour. 

If I am to leave one positive comment, the service has always been great in my past experience dining here.
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion as the reviewer is disappointed with the quality of the food at Red Lobster, particularly criticizing the excessive use of butter and oil, the average taste of the dishes, and questioning the popularity of the restaurant despite long wait times.

question: I don't know what has happened to RL, but the food is not nearly as good as it used to be, with the exception of the cheddar bay biscuits. My last two visits there were very disappointing. The food was bland. The lobster was tough and lacked flavor. Not interested in returning.
rationale: The reviewer expresses a negative emotion as they share disappointment in the decline in food quality at RL, mentioning bland food, tough lobster, and lack of flavor, making them uninterested in returning, which signifies a negative sentiment.

question:
I'm going to start by saying I really miss Yee's Laundry on Park street and that I've tried to fall in Love with Block Cleaners. I really want to support them... I'm a local guy - but they have lost my order twice, which required having to go back or stand around waiting while they look for my clothing and tell me how hard it's going to be to find. 

They are tough on buttons and if they break a button and bother to fix it at all, it's likely the button won't even be a serviceable match.

While they advertise same day service - I've never found this to be the case. I'd like to find another small dry cleaner and laundry that has an attention to detail. I'm open to suggestions
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion as the author recounts multiple instances of dissatisfaction with Block Cleaners, highlighting issues with lost orders, poor service quality, and false advertising, ultimately expressing a desire to find a better alternative.

question:
Quick Review: If it weren't for the stellar fish fry and the awesome beer selection, this place would be a solid 2.5-star establishment.  Alas, the fish is unreal and the beer selection rivals many (if not most) of Madison's finest.

Detailed Review:
The Fish Fry Fanatics stumbled into Dexter's Pub this past Friday and decided to give their fish fry a shot.  The menu selection is vast - we counted at least 6 or 7 solid fish fry options, from shrimp to Lake Perch to Walleye.  

We put our name in for a table, and were told it would be a 35-40 minute wait, so we ordered some of our customary Old Fashioneds.  We were pleasantly surprised to find that the bartenders muddle their Old Fashioneds, but were disappointed by the inclusion of a huge chunk of orange.  I'm sorry to say, but a Whiskey Old Fashioned Sour should *not* include half-of-an-orange as garnish.  

Regardless, the Old Fashioned was solid - very good, actually.  So much so that when we ordered a second round and requested they drop the orange, it wasn't a problem.  Dexter's recovered nicely, and as luck would have it, our table became available soon after we grabbed round 2 of drinks. 

We immediately ordered cheese curds, salad, and soup.  I went with the vegetable garden soup; others at the table went with chili and salad.  The soup and salads arrived within seconds; the soup was good - not great, but good - and it could've been a little warmer.  I'm told the chili was good as well - not life altering, but good.

The waiter came back to take our dinner order: two orders of beer battered cod, an order of lake perch, and an order of shrimp.  He said he'd be back in 10 minutes with our fish.  

Nearly an hour later, we flagged down a waitress for: refills on our drinks, and to inquire about our curds and fish.  She apologized profusely... curds came out a few minutes later - apparently they forgot about us.  The only benefit to being forgotten was that we had plenty of time to read the beer menu, which features a nice selection of craft beers from microbreweries - Dexter's doesn't strike me as a place that would feature such a wide selection of unique beers, but I guess it goes to prove that you can never judge a book by its cover.  

Curds were excellent - not your typical "from the bag" curds, which was a nice surprise.  They were breaded and featured a mild white cheese; they were cooked perfectly.

Fish arrived within minutes, and it was well worth the wait.  The cod was phenomenal.  Three huge pieces with a mound of fries - now that's what we're talkin' about.  The batter was light, crisp, and flavorful.  The fish was thick, meaty, and perfectly flavored.  I loved every single bite of it.

I also sampled the Lake Perch and shrimp - both of which were excellent as well.  Huge props to Dexter's for their fish fry - it's definitely a top-10 offering.

In the end, they also made things good as the waiter comp'ed us our drinks and curds, so we got out of there for under $40.  We tipped well and called it a night.  I'd definitely go back to Dexter's - sure, they dropped the ball, but they did an honorable thing and made everything right by us.  Thanks, Dexter's!!

Dexter's = WIN

Food = 4.5 stars (excellent fish; curds and fries were stellar)
Service = 2 stars (they forgot about us, but made up for it)
Value = 2 stars (would've been over $85 for the 4 of us)
Misc = 3 stars (the place isn't much to look at, but has an excellent beer selection...)

Oh - also, parking is hard to come by, so be prepared to park on the street and/or walk a bit to get there.
rationale: The text demonstrates positive emotion because it highlights the excellent fish fry offerings, the impressive beer selection, and the efforts made by the staff to rectify any issues encountered during the dining experience, resulting in an overall positive review. Predicted emotion: Satisfaction.

question:
So, I have been to Dexter's before to play some cards a few months ago, but it wasn't until I moved into the neighborhood that I decided to give the food service a shot. 

   I ordered a steak sandwich and some fries, it was one of the 3 specials being offered. The fries were decent enough, but the sandwich was bland dry and just quite dreadful, even for a pub. My friend then joined me and we ordered the worst cheese curds I've ever had in my life, and then we had the ironically named "super" nachos. The Super Nachos are anything but super. The ground meat (not positive what animal it came from) was again under seasoned and the chips were stale. I thought about sending them back, but I am chalking this up to the back of the house just doesn't give a shit about their job.

   The server was the three P's, Pleasant, Prompt, and Pregnant. She was the reason I will return and give the food another shot, and why this Pub is getting even two stars.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as it describes the disappointing experience with the food at the pub, pointing out bland and dry sandwich, dreadful cheese curds, and under-seasoned nachos. The positive sentiment comes from the server being pleasant and prompt, leading to a willingness to give the food another chance and awarding two stars.

question: Great food. Has a local feel, not quite dive-y but pleasantly local. Not unexpected based on the location. Went for the Bell's tap take-over for Mad-Craft-Beer-Week. Wife and I had the fish, right tastee.
rationale: The review mentions "great food" and a "pleasantly local" atmosphere, as well as positive comments about the taste of the fish they had. These positive descriptions and the overall positive tone of the review indicate a positive sentiment, likely leading to a feeling of enjoyment or satisfaction.

question: Had a great 5 piece perch fish fry with yummy waffle fries.  Good food, neighborhood bar.
rationale: This review shows positive emotion because it describes the food as great and yummy, which are words typically associated with satisfaction and enjoyment, and refers to the place as a neighborhood bar, indicating a comfortable and pleasant atmosphere. Predicted emotion: Positive

question: I love their friday night fish fry . The price is right and great bluegil and perch. I have to keep going back there. love it! I defeintely recommend fish or even sandwiches, burger. Oh, don't forget their greasy chili gralic fries :)
rationale:
The review mentions the customer's love for the fish fry, the affordable prices, the recommendation for various menu items, and the excitement to keep going back, all of which indicate a positive emotional response towards the dining experience. 

Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question:
I've been to Dexter's several times before for drinks and really liked the place, and a few months ago we went for the Friday fish fry and the food was delicious- some of the best fish fry we've had in Madison.  However, when we went back a month or so later, we had a horrible experience.  We had to wait nearly 45 minutes for our food and then when we got it- it was terrible.  My boyfriend had the garlic chili fries and they arrived not only COLD, but DOUSED in disgusting grease- they were inedible.  We mentioned it to the waitress and she offered to bring a new order, but it turned out the new order was just as terrible as the first one.  I had the roast beef sandwich and it was horrible- very dry and bland.  To her credit, the waitress did give us free cupcakes to take home to make up for the horrible food (although it turned out the cupcakes were also inedible and terrible).  

We hoped this was just an unusually busy night and not the norm, and because the fish fry is so good, we went back again tonight, hoping for a better experience.  We were wrong!  We went around 7 and waited 15 min or so for a table.  Once we were seated we placed our order right away with the waiter, since we already knew what we wanted.  An hour later, we were still waiting for our food.  All we ordered was the fish and waffle fries- so nothing complicated- and on such a busy night, you'd think they'd be making sure to keep batches of fish and fries going steadily into the fryer.
