rationale: The text demonstrates a positive emotion because the reviewer highlights the convenience of the location, their overall positive experiences with the food, especially enjoying the french toast, and the variety of options available, making it a fun place to visit with friends. Predicted emotion: Positive.

question: I came here for brunch on a saturday. I got the GLBT: Guacamole, lettuce, bacon and tomato. It was delicious! I love that this place serves Sprecher root beer. Seems like that's a standard for Madison, but I love it and I'm thrilled whenever I can order it. Yum! We also got one of their delicious pies to go, and it was killer. So even if you're full after breakfast or lunch, grab one of the desserts to go for later enjoyment. I thought service was good here; we got our food in a decent amount of time. \n\nBe warned, it can be hard to get to via car, since the street arrangement in that area is totally wacky. However, it's worth the hunt, since you get Monty's at the end. Now that the weather is nice, check out the botanical gardens afterwards, since it's close to this restaurant.
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as the reviewer expresses delight over the delicious food, enjoyment of Sprecher root beer, satisfaction with the service, and excitement over taking a pie home for later. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question: Monty's offers many vegetarian options. For example, they offer the Reuben sandwich for meat eaters and the Sheldon for vegetarians. I am consistently disappointed when I visit Monty's. On the last visit, I my fries were cold and my glass was dirty and cracked. A companion ordered a plain cheeseburger and it was loaded with onions. The carrot cake was obviously old--the cake was dried and the frosting was crusty. Another companion got the German chocolate cake which was also dry. It's a cool place, but needs better food.
rationale: The text demonstrates negative emotion as it describes various disappointing experiences with the food quality at Monty's, including cold fries, dirty glassware, incorrect orders, and old, dried out desserts, leading the reviewer to express consistent disappointment.

question: Maybe I got the wrong thing, but I'm thinking these Madison institutions thrive on folks who would rave about a can of Spaghettios if it was served as an original dish and was priced at $8.95... because that was my experience with a turkey club. I can't tell you what it tasted like, because all I could taste was the french roll it came on. Why you ask? Because it had once slice (yes folks - ONE slice of turkey), two slices of bacon, some tomato, and lettuce. I really paid nearely 9 bucks for a sandwich with one slice of turkey? Are east siders so beholden to their institutions that they are afraid to be critical of poor value, and sub par food? Service was service... nothing memorable, but then again I'm not expecting expert service at a place that serves soda in a plastic cup. Sorry if I sound bitter, but I'm really starting to get irritated w/ all this Madison dining nonsense. I have yet to be really thrilled by what I eat. Oh, and who toasts a hot dog bun? Cooking school 101 will tell you the bun will fall apart.
rationale: The text conveys negative emotion as the reviewer expresses disappointment and frustration with the poor value, subpar food, and lackluster service at a Madison institution, leading to irritation and dissatisfaction with the overall dining experience.

question: Corned beef hash, please marry me. You come with eggs, fruit, and a delicious biscuit. You are potatoey and oniony and wonderful. \n\nCoconut cream pie, you make my booty more bootylicious. Mmm.
rationale: The text uses playful and affectionate language to express admiration and pleasure towards the food items, indicating positive emotion. Predicted emotion: joy.

question: My wife and I have been here twice and have loved it each time!  This is not only a nice place to go if you're craving something vegetarian.  They have great sandwiches and bowls that are enjoyable,  The pies are usually fantastic!  So many choices...I don't think you can go wrong.  For a place that looks like your classic greasy diner, it offers a more home-cooked feel with a veggie vibe.  Definitely worth checking out!
rationale: The review highlights the positive experiences of the reviewer and praises the variety and quality of the food options, creating an overall upbeat and satisfied tone. The mention of enjoying the food multiple times with no disappointments suggests a positive sentiment of satisfaction and enjoyment.

question:
I love Monty's. The atmosphere is kitschy and cool, and they have something for everyone (even the vegetarians and picky eaters).

The wait can be a little on the excessive side, so don't hold off until you're hungry. 

I never manage to save room for dessert, but I hear the pies are excellent.
rationale: This review shows positive emotion as the reviewer expresses love for the restaurant's atmosphere, variety of menu options catering to different dietary preferences, and praises the desserts, despite mentioning a minor downside of a long wait time, indicating an overall positive experience. Predicted emotion: Positive.

question:
They always have better than average waitstaff. They have plenty of vegetarian options for classic diner food that they do very well. Many other places try to awkwardly replace meat with tofu and end up failing. Monty's mostly knows when to use seitan, beans, walnut burgers, tofu and has a nice variety.

They're often busy, so don't go if you can't wait. Some of the dishes are phenomenal and some are simply okay. I think it makes getting an average dish more disappointing when last time, you got something so wonderful, but c'est la vie. Remember what you like and see what others have enjoyed. (TNT BLT is amazing, the Sheldon is meh.)

Also, remember to eat your dessert first, the portions are generous and you don't want to miss out on such an important part of the meal.
rationale: The review praises the restaurant for its vegetarian options, variety of choices, and generous portions, indicating overall positive feelings towards the dining experience. Predicted emotion: Positive.

question:
Monty's is one of my fave brunch-or-lunch places, especially on lazy weekends when I want breakfast food at 2pm but do not want big-chain food.  They have a wide array of something for everyone from vegan offerings to biscuits and gravy to slices of cake taller than your head, and it's all tasty.  

It does get really crowded at peak times, and the service can be hit-or-miss to an extreme:  sometimes I've gotten a server who hangs around making hilarious jokes and sometimes I've been in parties that were actually forgotten about after we were seated and then have the orders wrong when we finally did get our food (although the bad service is definitely more rare than the good).  

All-in-all the tasty food and the kitschy atmosphere make it worth the wait.
rationale: The text showcases a predominantly positive sentiment as it highlights the delicious food options and kitschy atmosphere of Monty's, despite occasional issues with crowdedness and hit-or-miss service.

question:
Love this place. Gets crowded around the normal brunch time, so go early or go late. Otherwise, it's probably going to be at least a 30 minute wait.

Huge portions. Love their omelets. Lots of vegetarian options (if that's your thing - not mine). Haven't tried their desserts, but they always look tasty.

Service: Good. I've always had very nice servers. And I'm willing to cut them slack since they're always really busy. Plus they're pretty quick with the coffee refills.
Environment: Old school diner feel - with booths and stools! Doesn't feel cramped even when it gets crowded.

Side notes: I LOVE diners. Also, if you eat the biscuit, you're a fatty.
rationale: The text expresses positive emotion by highlighting the pleasant aspects of the diner, such as the delicious omelets, good service with quick coffee refills, and a non-cramped environment, ultimately conveying a sense of enjoyment and satisfaction.

question: Hash was a smash for me. Also Tim the owner sang us a Dylan song. Great biscuits, also liked the potatoes. It is a must try if you are in Mad-town.
rationale: The review contains positive language such as "smash," "great," and "must try," highlighting the enjoyable experience the writer had at the restaurant. Positive emotions are closely associated with words such as "great" and "liked", indicating a positive sentiment is likely.

question: Fantastic vegetarian and nonvegetarian food alike, great ice cream, adult beverage selection is to die for. Bloody mary's on a sunday morning? Yes please.
rationale:
The text mentions a variety of positive attributes such as fantastic food, great ice cream, and a wide selection of adult beverages, as well as expressing excitement for having Bloody Mary's on a Sunday morning, indicating an overall positive sentiment. 

Predicted sentiment: Positive

question: Great service and atmosphere.  The food is good - comfort food for the soul.
rationale: The text mentions great service, a positive atmosphere, and comfort food for the soul, all of which are typically associated with positive experiences, leading to a positive sentiment prediction.

question: Really cool & interesting veggie options, cool atmosphere, nice area, what more could you ask for? They even have a giant selection of pies! Voted best veggie restaurant in madison, but half of the menu or more isnt veggie, so everyone will be happy. Check it out.
rationale: The text expresses enthusiasm and satisfaction with the variety and quality of vegetarian options, the cool atmosphere, and the overall positive experience of the restaurant, indicating positive emotion. This suggests the predicted emotion is excitement or happiness.

question: Won best greasy spoon in Madison, yet has vegan options and bean salad as an alternative to fries! Yes, a great retro diner, but with modern options. And a dessert case. Awesome!
rationale: The text expresses positive emotion by highlighting the unique combination of winning an award for being a great retro diner while also offering modern options like vegan dishes and bean salad, showing versatility and inclusivity that excites the reader. Predicted sentiment: Positive emotion.

question: Yum.\n\nHave been here a few times, and have never left disappointed. It's an easy choice on my \"vegan\" days when I still want something that feels sort of bad for you and diner-y (versus Green Owl, which is fantastic but sometimes feels TOO healthy). All the sandwhiches I've tried have been great, and the pie is SOOO good - especially any one with peanut butter in it. Service can be a little slow and invisible, at times, but the food makes it totally worth it. Looking forward to hitting it up again in the fall.
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as the reviewer describes the food as consistently good, especially the pie with peanut butter, and expresses excitement about returning in the future, despite mentioning some slow and invisible service. Predicted emotion: Excitement.

question:
Oh my why didn't I review this place, like, a year ago?  

What's not to like about Monty's.  The only bad thing (which is really a great thing) is all menu choices, especially if you're a vegetarian.  It's sort of scaled-up-diner-food-meets-comfort-food, then add a fair share healthy options.  And great prices.  And great service.  Although it's not on Willy St. it still has the same friendly neighborhood atmosphere.  

So I've been to Monty's twice, both times late morning, and was seated and served quickly.  The first visit a friend and I split the spinach and feta omelet which was great and large enough for both of us, and a third friend had the salmon hash.  After our meal Monty himself (well, not sure if it was the Real Monty, so lets say the chef) came out to ask us how our meal was.  The second visit I went with a lunch item and ordered chicken fried steak, also great and the portions were easily enough for two people.  Once again Monty came out and greeted his diners!  Ordered a piece of Fat Elvis cake to go, which is banana cake layered with peanut butter fudge icing and topped with chocolate icing. Yum!
rationale: This review expresses positive emotion by highlighting the variety and quality of the food options, the great service, affordable prices, and the personal touch of Monty (or the chef) coming out to check on diners, creating an overall happy and satisfied feeling. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question:
In my opinion, almost all restaurants in the Madison area are bland. People may hate me for thinking it, but I don't care. There's no spice, little flavor, and it's gotten to the point where I just don't really go out, because I'm sick of wasting my money on mediocre food.

It got to the point where I thought my tastebuds were dying.

Enter Monty's Blue Plate. I had the meatless loaf sammich, and it was awesome, though it tasted nothing like meatloaf. The waffle fries? delicious. The dipping sauce? Don't even think of stealing a dip. I will bite you.

There was so much I wanted. I will be back, perhaps tomorrow. I will find excuses to wander to the east side, then say "While I'm here, I might as well hit Monty's".

All-in-all, Monty's is making my life better. Thank you Monty's.
rationale: The text expresses positive emotions because the author enthusiastically praises Monty's Blue Plate restaurant, describing the food as awesome and delicious, and expressing excitement about going back and making it a regular part of their life.

question: Eh. This place is \"fine\". I'm not terribly impressed with it. I could probably get better breakfast somewhere else. Plus its ALWAYS so so so busy in there. I like that they have a ton of vegetarian options. Which is rare for breakfast places. But meh. Its not amazing food.
rationale: The text expresses overall negative emotion as the reviewer mentions being unimpressed, not amazed by the food, and the constant busyness of the place, despite acknowledging the variety of vegetarian options. The sentiment predicted based on this rationale is disappointment.

question:
Pros:
Vegetarian Meatloaf of the Gods (with a yummy peanut gravy)
Lots of cakes/pies

Cons:
Slow and often rude service
Awful bloody maries (suuper salty) 
Overcooked poached eggs
Is it just me or is it always cold in there?
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as it lists various cons such as slow and rude service, awful drinks, overcooked food, and uncomfortable temperature, all of which contribute to a negative dining experience. Predicted emotion: Disappointment.

question: Great place, I visited there this weekend and the service was blazing fast. I had the goat cheese chicken sandwich and it was excellent!
rationale: The text mentions positive aspects such as fast service and excellent food, which typically lead to a positive sentiment of satisfaction and enjoyment.

question:
What a great place for brunch, not to mention filling!

I've only been there once, but had to try it because I kept getting so many recommendations. I had the chicken salad sandwich, not to saucy or creamy, and fresh. It had chopped chicken and salad on a ciabatta roll. it had a great flavor. I also switched out the fries for the house potatoes, which were also very good!

My boyfriend decided to go with breakfast and had the Huevos Rancheros, he loved it and said he would definitely get it again. He's a picky eater so if he says something like that I trust that the food is good. 

I also ordered one of their specialty milk shakes with coffee in it. What an amazing drink!!! 

I would definitely go back over and over again! And I'll wait with no problem because that usually means that the food is worth it...
rationale: The review describes the food and drinks at the restaurant in a very positive light, highlighting the delicious flavors, variety of options, and satisfaction of both the reviewer and their picky eater companion, creating an overall sense of enjoyment and happiness.

question:
The service is excellent, the atmosphere a time capsule of a 50s diner & the food is some of the best diner fair I've ever had. 

The Meatloaf is called the "Meatloaf of the Gods," and it truly is. I don't even like Meatloaf and I literally savored each bite of this culinary masterpiece. It is extremely filling because it is made with nutrient rich local meat, savory vegetables & topped with the best gravy I've ever tasted. Yum!  For $10, how can't it be "As good as it gets?"

If you like pie, also make sure to get a slice. It is delicious!
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as it highlights excellent service, delicious food, and a nostalgic atmosphere that creates a memorable dining experience. Predicted emotion: Satisfaction.

question: Gross, disgusting, rip-off. This place makes me seriously doubt the Madisonian palate. I had a cheeseburger from here a few nights ago. I asked for medium - which to Monty's means completely raw in random spots. Aside from the random rawness, the burger tasted like it was over seasoned with pepper. The meat was of absolute shit quality, the bottom bun was soggy (probably from undercooked meat juices), and I did get it to go. Thanks for the ketchup and mustard packets - now that's classy. I have no reason to set foot in this place. Every experience I've had up to point makes me wonder why I bothered to return one more time. Maybe there's something wrong with my palate, but to be honest, I'm pretty certain that there's not. East side institution? What a joke!
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as the reviewer expresses disgust and disappointment with the quality of the food, service, and overall experience, culminating in a feeling of regret and questioning the establishment's reputation.

question:
Monty's is one of the many mind-boggling Food Fight restaurants that is a Madison favorite despite serving mediocre food. 

I've eaten one good dish here: the TNT BLT (tempeh and tomato). And the chocolate shake is good if you need to consume an extraordinary number of calories on any given day.

The last time I went, I did so because a friend told me the restaurant is attempting to make a switch to more sustainability-conscious, organic food. I ordered chili that was pretty much inedible. On another night, my boyfriend ordered a soup that was, again, inedible. 

I can imagine that people like to come here because the restaurant resembles an old-school diner and has booths, which are fun for kids to sit in. But the food quality is generally average to poor. The brunch I've had is tasteless and limited, and you are not getting fresh eggs unless you order them over easy. 

The only reason I give Monty's two stars is because its pies are great. And once in a while, I can stomach a TNT BLT because someone I'm with persuades me to give Monty's one . . . more . . . try.
rationale: The text expresses negative emotion because it highlights the mediocre and inedible food offerings at Monty's restaurant, despite a few positive aspects like the decor and pies. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question: Yucky greasy food.
rationale: The text expresses a negative emotion because the food is described as "yucky" and "greasy," both of which have negative connotations related to taste and health. Predicted emotion: Disgust.

question:
A late night dessert run with my pregnant bestie led to a Monty's revelation:
They now serve (organic, classy) Sassy Cow ice cream, have even nicer and more delectable cheesecakes and their brownie sundae puts the Ella's Sparkled Kazoo to shame. 

Post-brownie sundae, bestie's baby to-be kicked. 

I think it was the hot fudge.
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as the author describes enjoying a dessert run with a pregnant friend, discovering new delicious menu items, and feeling the baby kick afterward, all of which evoke feelings of pleasure, excitement, and happiness. Predicted emotion: Joy.

question: Its a great place.  Both me and my wife thought it had a great summer feel in the 50s.  What's nice about it is that it has a Madison vegetarian twist.  If we would've been hungrier the pies looked amazing but our bellies had reached their capacity.\n\nOverall quality, its traditional american diner feel w/ a twist of Madison.  Great spot for a sit down lunch on a road trip.
rationale: The text highlights positive aspects such as the great summer feel, unique Madison twist, and amazing pies, all contributing to a positive dining experience, which evokes a sense of admiration or satisfaction. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question: One of our favorite Madison restaurants!  Great food (most of the time) and fast.  The non-booth side feels like a cafeteria, though, since the tables are so close together.  Great desserts too!
rationale: The review compliments the restaurant's great food and fast service, as well as praises its desserts, all of which are positive aspects that are likely to evoke a positive sentiment.

question:
We've eaten at Monty's a number of times and have always had good food there.   Service has also been good to excellent.   The veggie quesadilla is quite good.   Their prices are a little higher than we would like.
Bathroom and restaurant is very clean. 
When we are in the mood for something vegetarian Monty's is a safe bet.
I wouldn't really say I'm a fan but they do enough right to get 4 stars.
rationale: This text shows positive emotion because the reviewer mentions having good food and service at Monty's, enjoying the veggie quesadilla, noting the cleanliness of the bathroom and restaurant, and considering it a safe bet for vegetarian options, ultimately giving it 4 stars despite slightly higher prices. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question: Been several times and always the same. Fun space, menu reads very well and you expect to get a great meal, but food is totally plain and unexciting. All hat, not cattle.  Don't waste the time or money, many better options around town.
rationale: The text conveys a negative emotion as it expresses disappointment with the food being plain and unexciting despite high expectations from the menu, suggesting a feeling of wasted time and money. Predicted sentiment: Disappointment.

question: Disregard the sniffy reviews by food snobs; Monty's is great at being what it is, a nouveau diner with an eclectic menu, welcoming to old and young, hipster and square, LGBT and straight,etc. Great breakfast items (French toast,omelettes, scramblers, pancakes) available around the clock, lots of comfort food veg and non-veg dishes (\"meatloaf of the gods\" enchiladas, chili, etc.). Everything is freshly prepared with good ingredients. Not to mention the delicious pies and cakes..coffee is meh but that's par for diners. Prices are reasonable, two can be stuffed for $30. Friendly service by the mostly college student/artsy young person staff. If you're looking for a good solid (but not fancy-shmancy) meal on the E. Side of Madison, can't do better than Monty's.
rationale: This review demonstrates a positive emotion as it praises the restaurant for its diverse menu, friendly atmosphere, reasonable prices, freshly prepared dishes, and delicious pies and cakes, ultimately recommending it as a solid choice for a meal on the East Side of Madison. Predicted emotion: satisfaction.

question:
Here's a lil story about SWEET potato corned beef hash. 

Monty's will make it for you if you ask nicely. 

The end.

Alright that was the short version for those with an inability to read more than a few lines... here's the lengthier more tasty version! 

After having some lunchie and being pleasantly surprised by their afternoon eats, I decided it was time to give MBPD a try for brekkie. Holy options batman. This isn't your typical eggs, griddle, sausage type of place. They have some really inspired creations, and it was hard for me to pick between two. The corned beef hash (served with typical white potatoes and the sweet potato hash... more interesting taters but no meat) Hold up, wait a minute, how do you get both? You ask nicely. Really nicely. And low and behold moments later I had a plate of blended potato perfection and some chipped meat. It was rad. Deliciously rad. And served with amazing fruit, not just crappy melon as is typical during morning meal time and the best I'M TALKING THE BEST biscuit I've ever eaten. And I'm a guy who's had a few biscuits in his day, so trust. 

Now don't going running over there saying, "Corey said, Corey said!" But if you happen to get a nice server and you happen to strike up some nice conversation nicely ask for hot tuber take on their standards. And be nice if they charge you a little more. They're combining two dishes to make you happy after all. 

Nice.
rationale: The text exudes a positive sentiment as it describes the author's delightful experience trying out a unique and delicious dish, along with praising the friendly service and overall dining experience at the restaurant. Predicted sentiment: positive.

question: Always loved this place, but last time we tried it had a terrible experience.  Wanted to order fish and was told they no longer served it.  About 5 minutes later the same waitress brings out a huge fish plate for the lady next to us.  We are like \" What the HECK\" ????  Needless to say if we are not good enough to eat what anyone else gets, then we are taking our business else where.  The food that we got was not that great this time anyway.
rationale: This review shows negative emotion because the writer is expressing disappointment and frustration with the experience at the restaurant, particularly due to feeling misled and treated unfairly, ultimately leading to a decision to take their business elsewhere.

question:
I love diners.  I love Monty's.  I especially love the pie porn lingering on the other side of the glass so you can just gaze with wonder as you wait for your cibo.  

I ordered the Italian grilled cheese which had an exorbitant amount of cheese.  Seriously could have served a whole Italian family, that's how much mozzarella was squished in there.  Tasty? Hell yes.  

Alcohol is offered, wine and beer galore.  Woohoo!
rationale: The text conveys positive emotion as the author expresses their love for diners, particularly Monty's, and their satisfaction with the food, describing it as tasty and with an exorbitant amount of cheese, creating a sense of excitement and enjoyment. Predicted emotion: Excitement.

question: One of my favorite breakfast places in Madison.  The salmon hash is a dream.  And Tim bakes the best biscuits in town!
rationale: The text mentions the breakfast place as being a favorite, praises the quality of the salmon hash and Tim's biscuits, all indicating a positive sentiment towards the dining experience. Predicted emotion: Positive

question: good breakfast !! good service !! good place if your in Madison
rationale: The review mentions positive aspects of the breakfast, service, and location, indicating a positive overall experience which is likely to evoke positive sentiment.

question: Walnut Burger is the way to go.. Their bean salad as a side option is Delish. Not expensive, long waits on weekends in the mornings but worth it.
rationale: The text expresses positive emotion by highlighting the delicious taste of the Walnut Burger, the quality of the bean salad side option, the affordability of the food, and the overall worth of enduring long waits on weekends, indicating a positive dining experience. Predicted emotion: Satisfaction.

question: I love that this diner offers vegetarian/vegan options. Perfect for me and my omnivore hubby. Our waitress was great, too.
rationale: The text expresses positive emotion because the reviewer is pleased with the availability of vegetarian/vegan options at the diner, which caters to both their dietary needs and those of their omnivore partner, and appreciates the great service provided by the waitress, highlighting a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience. Predicted sentiment: positive emotion.

question: I'm sad to say that after a really great first experience over one year ago, Friday night's dinner at Monty's was very disappointing and I probably won't come back any time soon.  The host at the counter was not friendly.  My sandwich came on bread that was literally hard as a rock and then my husband was done eating before I even started my dinner because I sent it back and waited for new bread. The bread the second time around was greasy and the sandwich itself was dripping in grease.  GROSS.  My husband ordered the fish fry and they forgot part of his order.  It was just a bad day for Monty's....I might be back for dessert someday.
rationale: The text demonstrates negative emotion as the reviewer expresses disappointment with various aspects of their dining experience, such as unfriendly service, poor quality food, and missing items from the order, ultimately resulting in a decision to likely not return to the establishment.

question: This place is always excellent.    I've never left unhappy.    Even amongst so many good offerings in Madison, this diner stands out.   Plan your arrival carefully though, as there is often a long wait for tables.
rationale: The text showcases positive emotion because it praises the diner's consistent excellence, mentions never leaving unhappy, and highlights how it stands out among other good offerings in Madison, implying a sense of satisfaction and contentment. Predicted emotion: Positive

question: Stopped here for dinner before going out. Our server was friendly and efficient. The 50's diner motif was cute. Tons of vegetarian and gluten free options if you're into that sort of thing. I had the roasted turkey club and it was tasty. Awesome dessert options too so save room!
rationale: The text highlights positive aspects of the dining experience, such as a friendly server, cute motif, tasty food options, and awesome dessert choices, showcasing an overall positive sentiment.

question:
I had something to celebrate and hadn't been able to eat meat since watching a food documentary a few weeks prior, so Monty's seemed like the appropriate celebratory location.  I ordered their special: teriyaki tofu with peas, coconut, peppers and peanuts, served with a side of fresh pita.  The description was a little clunky--there were other ingredients in the dish description that I've since forgotten--and I got a kick out of listening to the waitress explain it to other patrons.  During a short wait, I sipped a heavenly hot chocolate.  My husband isn't a hot chocolate fan but agreed that it was really, really good.  FYI: they'll make it with soy milk if you ask.  After the food arrived it took me two seconds to realize that the tofu was the best I'd ever tasted.  Tender, flavorful, caramelized on the outside.  The sauce was a little saltier than I prefer, but still quite good.  The pita had good texture and a nice, buttery taste.  My husband enjoyed the traditional-type burger he ordered.  Our only disappointment is that we didn't save room for dessert.

Other observations:
-Going early helped avoid parking lot anxiety--they get Busy here.
-Our red-haired waitress was friendly, intelligent, and overall awesome.  Noting that I had ordered soy milk hot chocolate, she advised that the teriyaki tofu meal is prepared with a small amount of dairy.
-Staff brought water to a puppy who was sitting outside with his humans.
rationale: The text conveys positive emotion as the writer highlights enjoyable experiences like trying new food, a delightful hot chocolate, friendly staff, and overall satisfaction with the meal, only expressing regret for not having room for dessert, leading to a predicted sentiment of satisfaction and happiness.

question: So, it's not like this place was ever gonna make it outta my e-gutter, cuz there's nothing really redeeming about it. You know, sometimes a craving makes one act desperately... sometimes against one's better knowledge. Nevertheless, I make my way to Monty's one fine day, craving some sort of ice-cream based treat, similar to a beverage, but of a thicker consistency. Nothing special, just some plain old ice cream and say, caramel. It was $6.38?! Okay, so I go into a Vincent Vega state of mind, zoning out while the shake's bein' made thinking to myself \"Did I just order a six-dollars n' 38 cent shake? Sure did. A shake? Milk, ice cream, caramel? Uh-huh. Six-dollars n' 38 cents? Yep. They don't put bourbon in it or anything? Nope. Just checking... smh... Whoa, WHAT?! When it came up, it was in a small, flimsy styro cup, with a sad lil' wafer sticking out the top. Wait... did they just charge me like that much for this??? Ugh! I was so pissed, I told em' keep it, n' got my money back. I can get Culver's or Michael's for like, way better... Even the Chocolate Shoppe, or like, buy your own pint and a gallon of milk, stir in some Smucker's flavoring and have change to spare... I don't even know why people like this place. Dude, seriously...
rationale: The sentiment of this text is negative because the person feels ripped off and angry at the high price of the ice cream shake, resulting in them deciding to return it and expressing frustration at the lack of value for money, comparing it unfavorably to other cheaper options.

question: Abundant vegan options, even for breakfast!  Food is above average, service was great, prices really low.\n\nThe sweet potato hash with tofu scramble was especially good.
rationale: The text demonstrates a positive emotion as it highlights the abundance of vegan options, praises the above-average quality of food, great service, and low prices, with specific mention of the sweet potato hash with tofu scramble being especially good, which collectively creates a positive overall experience. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question:
Their banana pie and carrot cake are SUPER!!!!!!!
and if you happen to buy the whole container, you are required to give a 5-dollar deposit which will be returned if you bring it back.

Oh Monty, finally!
This morning, though I am still a little bit ill, I came only for you :) (and for me:))
Waiting for less than 10 minutes, we were seated by the window. A very nice spot. 

I decided quickly: I wanted to have a dish of scramble "something" (hahaha, I found this funny, I was wondering what "something" meant. I asked the server and she said it is for broccoli, pepper, some cheese (and God knows what else!-- too many to list! :D) and has no meat (yay!)
Hubby ordered a dish of pesto omelet! Both came with homemade biscuit- I'm in love with this biscuit right away! We enjoyed our brunch soooooooooooo much. 
I told the waiter: The food is excellent! I wanna come back soon!

The food is a five.
The service is a five.
Yes, full score for you, Monty. 

Sshhhhh, don't forget to also order their coffee and the donut.
The coffee is really an eye opener and the donut is ridiculously huge but so GOOD.

Monty has made my Saturday happy! and I really need that after one week of my illness :(
Mahalo, Monty!
rationale: The text conveys positive emotions by expressing excitement and satisfaction with the food and service at Monty's, as well as gratitude for making the author's Saturday happy after a week of illness, predicting a sentiment of happiness.

question:
I don't understand why this place is popular.  The food was bad and the service was bad.  I ordered a burger medium well and got it medium rare.  After sending it back and getting another it was still medium/medium rare but I was too hungry to send it back again and lost all faith in their cooks.  I think they served it on the same plate with the same cold fries as before.  My friend ordered a breakfast dish and it was terrible.  The scrambled eggs were so overcooked they were hard and rubbery, the potatoes were very undercooked, and the biscuit was dry and literally had no flavor.  None.  The service seriously lacked as well.  No one was unfriendly, just incompetent.

We thought the dessert would redeem them but after paying so much for a single slice of cheesecake we couldn't even finish it.  One slice was dried out and the other cheesecake had too much sour cream - it was actually mushy and very sour, almost spoiled tasting.

Bottom line, I found this place to be mediocre at best, and that's being generous. There's tons of better restaurants in the area and in the city.  Never going back, and I think the food has made me ill.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as the reviewer expresses disappointment and dissatisfaction with both the food quality and service at the restaurant, highlighting multiple instances of poorly cooked dishes and unpleasant experiences which resulted in them feeling unwell, leading to a predicted sentiment of disappointment and frustration.

question: I have been going here since the 90s and it has been up and down.  Some ok food, some terrible.  Once found fatty masses in my meatloaf.  Recently it has been just ok.  Inexpensive, pretty fast but low quality compared to other places on Willy street and mediocre compared to the many good options in Madison.
rationale: The review mentions mixed experiences over the years, including finding fatty masses in the food, indicating repeated disappointments and lower quality compared to other options, suggesting a negative sentiment. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question: It's unique diner food in a renovated old gas station. They have lots of  vegetarian options and a fantastic bakery!
rationale: This review shows positive emotion because it highlights the unique concept of a diner in a renovated gas station, offers a wide variety of vegetarian options, and mentions a fantastic bakery, all of which are appealing and exciting aspects that are likely to evoke positive feelings. Predicted emotion: Positive.

question:
Going to see a show or concert across the street at the Barrymore? Well, we all have to eat somewhere, why not Monty's? The first time I laid eyes on this joint, it was a few weeks ago after skipping dinner and going to Bo Burnham. I wondered if it was a bar or a restaurant, a week later, I found out that it's kind of both! It's a classic diner that happens to serve alcohol. I ordered and enjoyed the mushroom and swiss, but I came in on a mission. To order a burger. Their menu almost distracted me from my mission by offering breakfast all day. Oh, I shall return to conquer the idea of Breakfast for Dinner another time!

Waffle fries! need I say more on this topic? Well, its Yelp, so yes. Just the right amount of crispy and not too many. I also managed a dessert on my first visit, that portion size of the Oat Fudge Bar was enough for me to have skipped the fries or the burger, it was huge! Sadly there were nuts mixed in (personal preference), but that didn't stop me.

I didn't opt-in for a shake, but I should have. All I've learned about my visit is that I will have to make another trip before my next Barrymore concert!
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as the reviewer expresses excitement about discovering Monty's as a unique combination of a diner and a bar, enjoying the food like the mushroom and swiss sandwich and the waffle fries, expressing a desire to return for more, and already planning their next visit before a concert at the Barrymore. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question:
Monty, thank you for saving my restaurant foody soul last night.
After a disastrous meal at another restaurant, I was crabby, mad, moody and wanting to go home.  Luckily we drove by the shining light of the Monty's sign and pulled in to the parking lot.  
Grabbed a seat at the counter and ordered a piece of pecan pie a la mode for myself and my husband.  Your hostess, waitress, bus staff were all polite, welcoming, and doing their jobs.  They refilled our coffee, checking on our food, did we need anything else?  THANK YOU!
The pie was delicious, the ice cream melted slowly into the pecan crust and became a delicious consoling comfort food. 
My congratulation on being a place that I have visited for over 10 years and still makes the mark of having great staff, great food and ambiance.  That turquoise counter has never felt so good to lean my elbows on as last night.
rationale: The text expresses positive emotion by describing a positive dining experience at Monty's restaurant, highlighting the delicious food, good service, and comforting ambiance, ultimately expressing gratitude and appreciation towards the staff and establishment.

question:
Ok, this is bad news (for me and my waistline)... Second visit to Monte's was 1/27/14 for "dinner," although I was there for some breakfast vittles.

+ Breakfast ALL FREAKING DAY, EVERY FREAKING DAY - hip hip hooray
+ Excellent variety of breakfast grub
+ Reasonable prices

+ Servers have been friendly, efficient, and professional - just the right "warmth"
+ Atmosphere is classic diner; very familiar feel to it
+ Obviously shares a connection with Hubbard Ave Diner (both are FF restaurants)

+ Sweet Potato Hash: perfectly seasoned, nice slight char on the veggies, eggs were ever-so-slightly overcooked but still good
+ Breakfast Burrito: I'm a sucker for these things; chorizo is just a touch greasy; left a little film in the mouth, but that's chorizo for you... 
+ Good coffee, with speedy refills

I've heard the shakes and burgers are good; I'm too in love with the breakfast fare to venture to that side of the menu, but who knows... I'll give into temptation at some point, I'm sure.
rationale: The text praises the variety of breakfast options, reasonable prices, friendly servers, classic diner atmosphere, and well-seasoned dishes, highlighting positive aspects that overall convey a positive sentiment. Predicted emotion: Positive.

question: Nice atmosphere and fantastic food!  And I love their gluten free options.  They made things as we ordered them and the service was prompt and friendly.  This is a really nice \"diner\" with nice decor and a very friendly atmosphere.  The line was very long on Sunday morning but that's the sign of anything good because everyone wanted to eat there.  Nom nom, we'll be back! :)
rationale: The text expresses positive emotion by highlighting the nice atmosphere, fantastic food, gluten-free options, prompt and friendly service, and overall friendly atmosphere of the restaurant, which contributes to a pleasant dining experience and a desire to return in the future.

question:
This is just an average place. Its not bad. 
Parking is free, small lot but street parking around the area is possible.
Went there for brunch. 
Hippy looking teenage waitress was patronizing, Couldn't serve me a side of bacon with my Bloody Mary before my entree for whatever reason. 
Biscuit was dry, really nothing special. 
Salmon hash was average and not very many salmon pieces, mostly potatoes and onion. It was tasty none the less. Quantity was less than average. 
Bacon was just like what they serve at my hospital cafeteria, nothing special. 
There was a 25 minute wait which is always expected at a good brunch place. 
Bloody Mary was average as well. 

When I think of brunch I expect a quantity and quality as I am combining both meals. Here Quantity was slightly less than average, and quality was average. 



Noise level- Noisy, 

They take cards including AMEX

Have no idea why this place is so popular. Probably people haven't been to Original pancake house, much better service and far better food and cheaper too (they take only cash)
rationale: The review shows negative emotion because the customer had a subpar experience at the restaurant, with disappointing food quality, patronizing service, and a noisy environment, ultimately comparing it unfavorably to a better alternative. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question: Everything about this place was mediocre. The food was mediocre, the ambiance was mediocre and the service was mediocre.
rationale: The review shows a negative emotion because it describes everything about the place as mediocre, implying a lack of excitement or satisfaction. Predicted emotion: disappointment.

question: Great food and great atmosphere! Always fun!
rationale: The text mentions positive aspects such as "great food" and "great atmosphere," and also adds that it is "always fun," which indicates a positive sentiment towards the experience.

question:
Shut your mouth!  Meatloaf of the Gods!  There are three types of meat rolled into this meatloaf.  It comes with a red wine gravy, mashed potatoes and veggies.  All of this for $10.  Yup, a complete, well-rounded, mouth watering meal for just $10.  

The broccoli was blanched rather than steam.  So it was not mushy.  

The service is incredible.  The people are friendly and the food comes up fast.  I have nothing but good things to say.  On a date?  With family?  Have a small child?  Check this place out.  

They get desserts from a local bakery.  The carrot cake is ridiculous.  Are you full from your meal?  Take cake or pie to go.  Seriously, you will not regret a snack for later.
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as it highlights the delicious and affordable food, excellent service, and variety of options for different occasions, ultimately creating a sense of satisfaction and delight. Predicted emotion: Happiness.

question: I love this place and go all the time. I am vegetarian and it is a great spot to eat with my meat eating friends. It has a good mix of veggie friendly food and meaty dishes.
rationale: This review demonstrates positive emotion as the individual expresses love for the place, highlights its vegetarian-friendly options, and emphasizes the enjoyable experience of dining there with both vegetarian and meat-eating friends, suggesting satisfaction and contentment with the overall dining experience. Predicted emotion: Contentment.

question: great diner with good veggie and vegan options.\noverall very nice staff, friendly, prompt\ngreat desserts!
rationale: This text shows positive emotion because it describes the diner as great, with good vegetarian and vegan options, and highlights the very nice, friendly, and prompt staff, along with delicious desserts. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question: One of my Madison favorites.  Always something new to try.  Good staff, offbeat atmosphere, great service and food.  However I will note that not everyone I bring here has enjoyed their food... I think I talked it up too much.
rationale: The reviewer mentions positive aspects such as trying new things, good staff, offbeat atmosphere, great service, and good food, which all contribute to a positive emotion. However, the mention of not everyone enjoying the food due to expectations being too high introduces a slight negative aspect, leading to a mixed sentiment.

question: The biscuits and gravy on Saturday mornings is delicious.  By far the best thing on the menu, in my opinion.
rationale: The text positively emphasizes the deliciousness of the biscuits and gravy on Saturday mornings, indicating a strong personal preference for this item above all others on the menu, which suggests a positive sentiment towards the dining experience. Predicted emotion: Positive.

question: Came in for brunch today and had a very nice experience.  I really like their d\u00e9cor, classic diner style.  I got the Meatloaf and oh my goodness it was so AMAZING! The homemade gravy was to die for!  My friend got the Egg Mornay I didn't try it but it looked delicious.  Our server Eric was also amazing! I will definitely be returning soon, for a first time experience I give five stars! \n\nAs a side note as we were walking out every single employee that we passes said, \"Thank you, have a great day.\"
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as the reviewer had a very nice experience, enjoyed the food, praised the decor and service, and expressed intention to return, giving five stars for their first time experience, with the employees being polite on the way out.

question: I love this place! They have amazing cheesecakes, breakfast options and yummy sammies. My favorite thing to eat is the grilled chicken and goat cheese sandwich! The flavors are so fresh and work well. I also love to sneak raspberry cheesecake when I am done ;)
rationale: This text shows positive emotion because the reviewer expresses love for the place, excitement for the food options, appreciation for the flavors, and enjoyment of their favorite dishes, culminating in a sense of satisfaction and happiness. Predicted emotion: happiness.

question: Love the BLT
rationale: The positive sentiment is indicated in the short review with the word "Love," which conveys a strong sense of enjoyment or satisfaction. The simplicity of the statement "Love the BLT" suggests a positive emotional response towards the BLT, most likely indicating satisfaction or happiness.

question: We love this place! The food is great. The biscuits which I love the most is the best! I love the coffee. I come here once a week with my in laws and two sons. This is our spot in Madison for comfort food. It's just family friendly and the prices are great. Who doesn't like a hot cup of coffee and comfort food :) Yummo to this place!
rationale: The text shows positive emotion by expressing love for the place, praising the food, the biscuits, and the coffee, and emphasizing the comfort and family-friendly atmosphere, indicating a strong sense of satisfaction and enjoyment. Predicted Emotion: Satisfaction.

question:
Monty's is one of those places where you start going to as a little kid, and continue going to well past your 70s. I could definitely see myself here years from now shaking my head disapprovingly at the rowdy young'un's over my newspaper (aka some form of electronic tablet at that point).

Monty's serves up some classic breakfast items, including the standard buttermilk pancakes, bottomless coffee (sorry millenniums, no mimosas here) and various omelets.

The servers here are extremely down to earth and friendly, and their chefs cook a mean meatloaf (highly recommended). 

What to get away from the glitz and glamour of most brunch places these days? Come by Monty's for some ultimate comfort food!
rationale: The text shows positive emotion as it highlights the nostalgia and comfort associated with visiting Monty's over the years, the friendly service, and the recommendation of the delicious meatloaf, evoking a sense of warmth and satisfaction. Predicted sentiment: Nostalgic and content.

question:
Craving a chocolate malt, I stopped in on a walk around 3 pm on a Friday afternoon. The place was largely empty, and spotless. I haven't been to Monty's in several years, after suffering from 'stomach issues' after dining here back then, I couldn't bring myself to chance it again.

No issues this time, I'm happy to report. I ordered a triple chocolate malt to go. Chocolate (Sassy Cow!) ice cream, chocolate milk and chocolate syrup. Really good, and worth the $7 price tag. Definitely killed the craving, and put a happy spring in my step for the rest of my errand walk around the Atwood area.

The service was fast and friendly, as there were more than enough employees waiting around for the afternoon and evening dinner rush to begin. Maybe next time I'll be brave enough to try the food again :-)
rationale: The text shows positive emotion because the writer had a satisfying experience at Monty's with no stomach issues this time, enjoyed a delicious triple chocolate malt, appreciated the fast and friendly service, and felt happy and satisfied after their visit, leading to a predicted emotion of satisfaction.

question: Went here last night after an exhausting day taking care of a newborn. Thankfully my baby slept through our entire dinner despite how loud the place is. The decor is simple but spacious and the service is really good and fast. We were seated immediately (on a Saturday night! ) and were served water by the waitress right away. She was friendly and always nearby her customers. My husband had the Mediterranean omelet  (can't remember what It's called). It had feta cheese,  mushrooms and spinach with potatoes on the side and a biscuit.  It was so good I wanted to steal his plate.  I got the meatless meatloaf.  It was very filling and the gravy was good but the  portion was way too big. By the time we were done we had no room for the amazing looking cheesecake. I guess we will have to come back to try dessert.  Oh and the couple next to us ordered an ice cream Sundae, it was ridiculously huge and looked awesome. Good for sharing!  I definitely recommend this once for simple diner food done well.
rationale: The text shows positive emotion because the writer had a good dining experience, highlighted by the excellent service, delicious food, and the enticing dessert options, which leads to the predicted emotion of satisfaction.

question: Their food is ok.  I would not call it special or extraordinary, but it is not bad.  The service is less than desirable.
rationale: This text conveys a negative emotion because it mentions that the food is only okay and not special or extraordinary, with the added criticism of the service being less than desirable, indicating overall disappointment or dissatisfaction.

question: My dad and I both had the Heathen Vegan Shoplifters Delight. Basically portobello mushrooms, tempeh, and avocado. Amazing. Great section of vegan and non vegan options. Loved it.
rationale: The text expresses positive emotion by praising the food as "amazing" and highlighting the variety of both vegan and non-vegan options available, showing appreciation for the experience at the restaurant.

question:
Big plates of food. Awesome staff. So, so many shake/malt options. 

This is the place I usually come after my flight has landed in Madison. The food isn't aiming to be some crazy, new, cutting edge concoction. It's homey and it's familiar. 

I've been to a lot of diners. Not every diner does it right, but this one does. If you want tasty food, and ample servings of it, at a good place then this is the place to go.
rationale: The review highlights positive aspects such as big plates of food, awesome staff, a variety of shake/malt options, homey and familiar atmosphere, and tasty and ample servings of food, indicating a sense of satisfaction and enjoyment, leading to a predicted emotion of satisfaction.

question:
My partner and I came with two friends who were from out-of-town. I had heard really good things about Blue Plate, and I wanted to try it out, but I wish we had left when we saw there was a wait.

We ended up waiting for a table for around 45 minutes. While waiting I had to use the restroom--disgusting. There was no soap in the dispenser, water all over the counter and floor, and paper towels crumpled everywhere. I realize this is largely because of the patrons, but you would expect somebody from the staff to pop in every once in a while to make sure everything is neat and in stock. 

When we finally got a table, service was rushed and impersonal. I was a little dismayed that a manager never came over to at least thank us for waiting for so long, but who knows if a manager was even there? It seemed totally chaotic and like nobody was in charge. Lunch was okay, but nothing special. I had an omelette that was pretty good, but the breakfast potatoes that it came with were soggy, and while some of the potatoes were heavily seasoned, others didn't have any seasoning on them whatsoever and tasted horribly bland. I also had to wait several minutes before I could even eat because the server who delivered the plates (not our server, who spent approximately two minutes at our table in total) brought everyone else's meals out first and left mine in the kitchen. 

Will not be back.
rationale: The review showcases several negative aspects of the dining experience, such as long wait times, poor restroom condition, rushed and impersonal service, lack of managerial presence, and mediocre food quality, culminating in the decision to not return, indicating an overall negative sentiment.

question: Such a fun place to get an interesting plate of great food.  The neighborhood is awesome and you can see it in their customers.  Great selection of pies,  and will take suggestions on what to offer.  Love their raspberry cream pie! May seem hipster but this is the real deal.
rationale: The review praises the restaurant for offering great food in a fun and interesting setting, showcasing a positive attitude towards the place and its offerings. Predicted sentiment: Positive emotion.

question: This place was great! The food was stellar. There wasn't a part of the meal that was disappointing. Kudos!\n\nThe meatloaf is so good, my meatloaf-hating boyfriend is getting it next time.
rationale: The review expresses positive emotion through enthusiastic praise of the food, mentioning how there was no disappointment in the meal and even noted that someone who usually dislikes meatloaf enjoyed it. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question: Friday night in Wisconsin and we couldn't resist the fish fry. It didn't disappoint. Fast, flavorful, perfectly crisp and just the right amount of food. I love that they have a local beer selection on tap and in bottles. Service was attentive and friendly. While waiting, we had the opportunity to observe their operations and I was suprised. The man that appeared to be the manager or owner, was helping in any way that he could. I think we watched him take reservations, run water, bus tables, greet guests, seat guests, basically anything to help offer excellent customer service. The highlight was the PIE! Oh my! I had a slice of oreo deliciousness that rocked my world! Light and fluffy with an oreo cruble crust and a huge slice. I savored that one piece three times! Worth every calorie! I can't wait to go back and try others dishes! \n\nOh and they also have an extensive vegan menu if that's your thing.
rationale: The review describes a positive dining experience, highlighting fast service, flavorful food, attentive staff, delicious dessert, and a variety of options including a vegan menu, showcasing satisfaction and excitement, predicting a positive emotion.

question: I didn't particularly care for the food, but I loved the length of the vegan menu and I can't wait to come back and try the rest of it, even if it is just to be disappointed.\n\nWe waited for about a half hour and were seated likely as the last Friday rush made its way out. I had the sweet potato hash. I couldn't taste much besides the sweet potato, and even that was masked by the heavy spices added to the top. I wouldn't order it unless you're really into hash. The apple pie \u00e0 la mode was solid (as in yummy, but also as in not runny). Prices were good, service was attentive. Remember to check in with Yelp to get a free coffee!
rationale: This review shows positive emotion because, despite not liking the sweet potato hash, the reviewer enjoyed the vegan menu's length, looks forward to trying more dishes, found the apple pie delicious, appreciated the prices and attentive service, and even mentions a bonus offer for a free coffee, which overall creates a positive sentiment towards the restaurant experience.

question: Still great. Thanks to Yelp and Monty's for the free check-in coffee. Service good despite the full house. Our server forgot a glass of milk, felt terrible amd immediately comped it. GREAT service.  We'll be back.
rationale: The text mentions positive aspects such as receiving a free coffee, good service, and a server who immediately addressed a mistake by comping a forgotten item, all of which contribute to an overall positive experience, indicating a positive sentiment in the review.

question: Amazing is all I can say. They have absolutely everything. No, it's not organic but it's super homemade and killer. I get something different every time I am there and have yet to be disappointed. All the brats, beef, chicken, BACON are all wonderful. Support local butchers or they will disappear! Perfect example, I went in and asked for a pound of italian sausage (kale/cauliflower/sausage pot pie, yum!) and they were out but they offered to make me some on the spot. Really amazing service and great product quality. Make the trip to Jim's
rationale: This review shows positive emotion as the reviewer is highly impressed with the wide variety and quality of products, excellent service, and willingness to accommodate special requests, ultimately recommending others to visit the store, suggesting a predicted emotion of satisfaction and happiness.

question: Love this place and the people that run it. They're just an old school neighborhood meat market.  Burgundy steaks are the best. Great deals ALWAYS!!!
rationale: The review expresses positive emotion by showing appreciation for the place, the people, and the quality of the Burgundy steaks, alongside mentioning great deals, indicating a high level of satisfaction and enjoyment. Predicted emotion: Satisfied.

question: We stayed in Madison Lakes rooms, it was beautiful - modern, comfortable, very well put together.  Being dog friendly was a great treat and we got to bring our 4 legged friend with us, who loved the stay.  The property is wonderful and the owners incredibly nice.  Breakfast was really great, a wonderful way to start the day.  The only reason I give 4 and not 5 stars is that it is somewhat close to the highway, which detracts from the tranquil nature of the property, though not enough to prevent me from staying again.
rationale: The text shows positive emotion because it highlights the beautiful, modern, and comfortable amenities of the Madison Lakes rooms, the property being dog-friendly, the friendliness of the owners, and the great breakfast, with the only minor drawback being the proximity to the highway, which is not significant enough to deter the reviewer from staying again, overall portraying a favorable experience.

question: I should have left this review back in November when I stayed here with my parents - every time I look through our vacation photos I think about how much fun I had showing them Madison... and how we enjoyed where we stayed just as much.  Pat and Bob and Happy (their dog) were wonderful and their food was amazing.  They make many of the ingredients on their property (fresh maple syrup anyone?).  Would go back in a heartbeat.
rationale: The text expresses positive emotion as the reviewer reminisces about the enjoyable time spent with their parents, praising the hosts, the accommodations, and the food, highlighting the desire to return in the future, indicating an overall sense of satisfaction and happiness. Therefore, the predicted emotion is satisfaction/pleasure.

question:
This place was wonderful all around. I would return and I would recommend. It is a bit higher price point, but it is such a great space it is worth it. If you are looking to get away, relax, have a romantic weekend, enjoy nature, this is a great place. If you just need a place to sleep you might want something less expensive (unless you can afford it). 

The first floor of the house is very clean and neat, but has a very comfortable and cozy feel. There is a small kitchenette stocked with coffee, tea, cold drinks and lite snacks. If we stayed longer I could see relaxing down there enjoying a glass of wine, playing a game or reading. There is a nice selection of wine available to purchase so you don't even have to go out. 

Our room was very nice. King sized bed, robes, our own deck with a great view of the sheep. The bathroom had a big Jacuzzi tub and a large duel-head shower. We enjoyed glasses of champagne on the deck before heading out to explore and hike around their land. 

He had dinner downtown Madison which was an easy drive to and from. When we returned we were happy to have the fireplace in our room and cozied up with some of freshly baked cookies left out for guests. 

Breakfast was delicious. Farm fresh eggs from their hen's, herbs from the garden and all the other ingredients were local. We had good conversation with the other couple staying there as well as the owners.

Great place!
rationale: The text showcases various positive aspects of the place, such as cleanliness, cozy ambiance, stunning views, luxurious amenities, delicious breakfast, and good customer service, which overall elicits feelings of satisfaction and enjoyment, leading to a predicted positive sentiment.

question: Wow, 5 stars? Did we stay at the same hotel? This location is the newer version where the room entrances are enclosed which is a plus. They've also had their renovation in the lobby with the high counter/seating area.  But my room smelled like stale smoke and the desk was really small.\n\nSo while the staff was super friendly and the location is actually more convenient to where I needed to be in Madison, on my return trip I opted to stay in the HGI in Middleton than endure another week in this less than acceptable Hampton.
rationale: The reviewer acknowledges positive aspects such as the hotel's new amenities and convenient location but expresses negative sentiment towards the room's smell of stale smoke and small desk, ultimately deciding to stay at a different hotel on their return trip, indicating a negative emotion.

question: Front Desk was rude and not helpful whatsoever. The rooms were small and when we got to our room there was pee in the toilet still. Would choose a different hotel if I was you.
rationale: The review expresses negative emotion by describing the front desk as rude, the rooms as small, and there being pee in the toilet, which would likely lead to dissatisfaction and frustration with the overall experience.

question: The room was clean and modern. The hotel has been renovated recently.  Customer service at the desk was great.  I would definitely stay again. Free breakfast, They have a pool, but it was being renovated so we didn't get to use it.  My only complaint would be that the eggs and sausage in the breakfast were pretty bad.  But they were free so can't complain too much.
rationale: The review primarily focuses on positive aspects such as clean and modern room, recent renovation, great customer service, willingness to stay again, free breakfast, and the presence of a pool, which indicates a positive sentiment overall. The mention of the breakfast items being subpar is outweighed by the positive aspects, leading to a positive predicted sentiment.

question:
So close to the airport, but remains off the grid. The Villa Tap neighborhood bar looks as it hasn't changed in forty years. The wooden bar is topped with a baseball cards that have a laminate over them.

Want to drink? Stop over. They have friendly bartenders and great prices. The bartenders do a nice job on the bloodies and Old Fashioneds.

Want to eat? Om nom. They have some type of food every night, but their Friday fish fry is worth going. The perch or walleye is what you should get. Even though it was busy when we were there, the servers were funny, had a good attitude, and our food came promptly. They know what the hell they are doing.
rationale: The text describes a neighborhood bar that has a cozy, nostalgic atmosphere, friendly staff, delicious food options, and efficient service, creating a positive and welcoming vibe. Predicted emotion: Positive.

question: Looks sketch from the outside, but true fish fry happiness awaits! I have been going to this place for about one year.  The first time we went later around 9 pm or so and a lot of the fish was gone.  I had an amazing hamburger instead, meat from Jenifer St Market. Besides the first time, I have always gotten the fish.  The perch is amazing and be sure to get the loaded baked potato.  The craft beer selection is impressive.  Chico-the owner is usually cooking, it's a small kitchen, so be prepared to wait, but it's worth it. My fiance usually gets the walleye and loves it. It's now my go to place for fish!
rationale: The text highlights positive experiences such as enjoying the amazing perch, loaded baked potato, craft beer selection, and the owner's dedication to cooking, which overall creates a sense of happiness and satisfaction, leading to a positive emotion being conveyed. In this case, the predicted emotion is happiness.

question: Another strictly pinball review. \nAround thanksgiving the Ideal was had Simpsons Pinball Party. SPP is a lot of fun but never lasts long at any one stop in Madison (first played it at the Plaza this past summer) because it always has mechanical issues going on. \nStopped in the other night to find Walking Dead (which you can also find at the Up North currently). I haven't seen a lick of the TV series, Walking Dead so I admit I'm missing something but this game was just plain boring in my book. 4 stars for having a functioning (and new!) pinball machine - I bet Walking Dead fans will feel differently than I do about this one.
rationale: The text shows negative emotion as the reviewer found the Walking Dead pinball machine boring and lacking in excitement, contrasting it with the enjoyment experienced with the Simpsons Pinball Party machine. Predicted emotion: Disappointment.

question: The burgers are amazing and ridiculously reasonable! The staff is friendly and attentive. The place is super clean! They do everything right at Players! Good drinks, great lunch specials and awesome service!
rationale: The review praises multiple aspects of the restaurant, such as the quality of the burgers, the friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness of the place, and the overall experience provided by Players, indicating a positive sentiment towards the establishment.

question: Do NOT go here if you are looking for a nice 4 1/2 star place. Not very clean and very loud!
rationale:
The text mentions that the place is not very clean and very loud, which typically evokes negative emotions related to a disappointing experience. 
Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question:
So I've been hearing this joint has one of the "Best" burgers in town. I'm generally reluctant to order a bar burger - they are generally frozen and then cooked to well done. Not at Players - hand pattied in view of the customer. Meat is from the Jennifer Street Market - Right around the corner. 

You want your burger rare - Fine... It's rare... Sha- Freaking- Zam! I think perhaps the only Burger Joint in town that is capable of cooking a burger properly to order. 

Sandwiches come with pub chips - you can upgrade to fries for a buck... Other stuff like onion rings for $2.  The sides are frozen and then dropped in the fryer. But you are here for the burgers - they are fresh, as is everything on them. The tomato on my burger was actually tasty. My only complaint is the burgers could use a more robust bun... But the fact that Players can properly cook a burger makes this discretion forgivable.

So go to this locals joint blue collar bar - have a beer, get the drink special and order a freaking burger!
rationale: The review showcases positive emotion as the writer expresses surprise and satisfaction at the high quality and freshness of the burgers, highlighting the unique ability of the restaurant to cook them properly to order, making it an overall positive experience. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question:
Ah, yes.  The site of where one of my profile pictures was taken.  I could not resist the allure of a bar that had a giant neon "Drink Blatz" sign hanging above the door.  I am, after all, a Wisconsin girl.

The boy and I went on some random weekday night in the winter.  It was a very large, divey, unattractive hole-in-the-wall as you would correctly surmise from the Blatz sign.  Fortunately, I love townie dive bars, and therefore, was comfortable with this.

We each ordered a beer on tap from the nice, older lady who was bartending, (PBR and Leinie's, if I remember correctly) and paid something like $3 total.  Sexy.  Very sexy.

As we drank our beers, we decided to arm wrestle.  The bartender was going outside for a smoke and cheered me on.  My back was to her, but my boyfriend told me that she mouthed the words "Let her win" to him.  Haha!  She came back later to see if I'd won or not.  :)

I need to go back post haste!
rationale: The text describes a fun and lighthearted experience at a dive bar, where the writer felt comfortable, enjoyed cheap drinks, and had a good time with the bartender's playful support, ultimately leading to a desire to return in the future, indicating a positive sentiment. Predicted sentiment: Positive.

question: This place SUCKS!  Every time I go in here it depresses the shit out of me.  People say it's haunted and I would agree - haunted by degenerates and meth heads.  I always say I'll never go back but that never happens...
rationale: The text demonstrates negative emotion by describing a negative experience at the place, mentioning that it depresses the author and associates it with degenerates and drug users, expressing a strong dislike and a vow to avoid it in the future.

question:
I miss "my old Menards" - the west side store is so awesome; it has a great layout, decent checkout speed, things are easy to find, it's big and bright... Unfortunately, this Menards shares nothing in common with its western sibling.

+ Fairly close to my home
+ Typical Menards stuff

- Horrible layout; things are just scattered about in odd places.
- Lack of sufficient, active checkout lanes
- No room in checkout lanes for your items to accumulate as you're paying for them

I wish Menards would choose a store layout and stick with it across all locations.
rationale: This review shows negative emotion as the author expresses disappointment, frustration, and a sense of wishing for consistency and improvement in the Menards store layout and checkout process. Predicted sentiment: Negative.

question:
I've revisited this Menards countless times over the past few months. Lately, I've only been coming here when I absolutely must; I much prefer going to my local hardware store - their selection for anything that's not a big-ticket item is better, as is the service and overall experience. 

- There are signs posted in several places that claim, "No waiting for savings! If there are more than 2 customers waiting to check-out, we'll open additional check-out lanes!" -- I have yet to see this happen. A most recent visit left us waiting in line for nearly 10 minutes before checking out.

- The indoor/outdoor lumberyard is a source of frustration. I would venture a guess that one of the more commonly sought items from a hardware store like Menards is the basic 2x4 (or similar dimensional piece of lumber). Any idea where they're located? We wandered the indoor lumberyard for a good 5 minutes before realizing that the 2x4s are located in the faaaaaaaaaar back corner from the main entrance. You have to walk by scores of 1-by-whatevers, fence posts, fence slats, decorative posts, synthetic decking, lattice, and other rarely used items before you get to the 2-by-whatevers. Do you need pressure treated wood? That's outside, somewhere. Do you need cedar? That's on the opposite end of the indoor yard. Do you need plywood? It's at the front of the lumberyard. Do you need insulation? It's in the middle of the lumberyard... catch the problem? There's zero organization/logic...

- The outdoor lumberyard. I hate (as do my contractor friends) checking in and out with the lumberyard guard. Put it all inside like every other store does and call it good.

- Limited supply of plumbing items. I recently needed a Sharkbite connector for a plumbing project I was doing with PEX. Menards didn't have the fittings, but my tiny little local Ace Hardware did. A few days ago, I needed a John Guest fitting, which Menards didn't have, but my local Ace Hardware did. 

+ Holiday sales are usually a good deal, especially for large ticket items like ceiling fans and whatnot.
rationale: The review mentions several frustrations with Menards, such as long wait times at checkout, disorganization in the lumberyard, and limited supplies of certain items, which highlight a negative emotional response towards the store. Predicted emotion: Frustration. Rationale: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with various aspects of Menards, emphasizing their preference for a local hardware store and detailing the issues they encountered, indicating a negative sentiment overall.

question: As everyone in Madison knows, there are no doughnut chain stores around.  No Krispy Kreme.  No Dunkin Donuts.  Although I know that the best doughnuts in town are from the Greenbush Bakery, sometimes it's just easier to go with the place down the street.  \n\nThat basically sums up the People's Bakery.  When you're too lazy to go anywhere else, they are pretty good.
rationale: This text shows a slightly negative emotion as it compares the People's Bakery to the best doughnuts in town, implying it is only a convenient option when one is too lazy to go elsewhere. Predicted emotion: slight disappointment.

question:
I've been lamenting the lack of Mediterranean establishments on the Eastside for a while. We have arguably the best Thai, Indian, Nepali, Jamaican, Japanese, Chinese and American restaurants in town. But Downtown and the Westside both hold the Mediterranean trump card.

Then I discovered People's Bakery. How can you go wrong? Fresh pastry AND gyros? Wait. Did I say gyros? Yes, I did. No longer do you have to venture downtown to get said sandwich. And the one I had wasn't a ticking grease bomb!

Do yourself a favor when you go and try the red lentil soup. The flavor is excellent and there's plenty of cumin to spare. Delicious! My gyro and bowl of soup plus coffee was under $10, so it's a great choice when you're low on cash and need a filling lunch.

(Oh, and it's right next to El Pescador, across from the Madison East Shopping Center. Pretty easy to miss when driving.)
rationale: The text showcases positive emotion by expressing excitement and satisfaction about discovering a new Mediterranean restaurant that offers delicious food at an affordable price, filling a gap in the Eastside dining options. Predicted Emotion: Excited and Happy.

question: I usually go here because they have some Halal dishes but it's definitely not my \"go -to\" place for Halal.  I find that I have to be in the mood for it in order to really enjoy it.  However, my husband swears by their chicken and I do really enjoy their kefta with rice.
rationale: The review mentions that the person usually goes to the restaurant for Halal dishes, indicating a positive sentiment towards that aspect, but also implies that it is not their first choice for Halal food, suggesting a slightly negative sentiment due to needing to be in the right mood to fully enjoy it. Overall, the positive sentiment towards the chicken and kefta dishes would likely result in a neutral to slightly positive emotion.

question:
The food and service attitude is pretty good for the price you pay.
They also got all kinds of beverages to go with your meal. They cook it fresh after you place an order. The owners are very nice.

We had the vegetarian meza. Everything tastes good, though I've definitely had better middle eastern food before. But for the price you pay, the food is well worth it. All the basics are done right, e.g. dolma, hummus, kabob/shawarma, cucumber yogurt, kofta, kebbi, etc.

But I will mention stuff they could improve a bit more:
The red pepper paste was a bit bitter, but taste fresh
Tabouli was a bit saucy (ask them to use less dressing).
